loans.name: Hernilta Isabel

texts.es:
Hernilta, una campesina llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una actividad común en el municipio de Momil, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Hernilta solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos de aproximadamente 70 kilos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 8 horas en distintas actividades, es una mujer rebuscadora e inquieta
texts.en:
Hernilta is a country woman full of dreams and ambitions, chiefly to improve her family's life through the sweat of her brow. That goal is why she went into business raising pigs, a common livelihood in Momil. She has earned a reputation for reasonable prices and the quality of the animals she raises. 

Hernilta is applying for a loan for the purchase of pigs weighing approximately 70 kg so she can fatten and then sell them. The sole purpose of her business is to provide for her family and make their lives better. Her family is what drives her tenacious and tireless spirit.  

Hernilta is a resourceful and energetic woman who works 8-hours a day every day at the various tasks that her business requires.

loans.use: to purchase 70-kg pigs that she'll fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of retail household goods for her shop

loans.name: Inirida Isabel

texts.es:
Inirida, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Vive en el municipio de Las Córdobas junto a su esposo (Ver Foto).

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 6 años cuando decidió tener su negocio de venta de tamales y huevos.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos como maíz, harina, carne, y por supuesto huevos al por mayor para abastecer su inventario y poder tener una cantidad de ingredientes que le permitan mejorar sus ventas.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
Inirida lives in the town of Las Córdobas with her husband (with her in the photo). Her current focus is to work hard and remain strong as she confronts various challenges. 

Inirida therefore works diligently each day, always with a beaming smile and charm that have served her well since she decided six years ago to start a business selling tamales and eggs. 

Inirida is applying for a loan to purchase wholesale items such as corn, flour, meats, and of course eggs to boost her inventory. This investment will allow her to stock up with a large quantity of ingredients so she can boost her sales. She knows that the support of Interactuar and Kiva lenders will help her keep growing her business sustainably.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale items such as corn, flour, meats, and of course eggs to boost her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified farm inputs for more production.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to pay the maintenance costs of her computer shop and buy necessary spare parts for the units she maintains. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Ma. Luz is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 20,000 Philippine peso loan. She will use the new loan to purchase an additional computer unit she needs to improve her service and profit. Simultaneously, this will allow Ma. Luz to meet her family's needs.

Ma. Luz hopes to see her business more established as well as their lives improved. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional computer unit.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is 37 years old, married, and supports 5 family members. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Emmah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy farm tools so as to improve her agricultural produce for sale in the market. She plans to use anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools so as to improve her agricultural produce for sale in the market.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Susana works hard to support her family. She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and fattening pigs. 

Susana is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more snack foods to resell.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to resell.

loans.name: Sengkea

texts.en: Sengkea is a 34-year-old widowed mother of three young children. She lives with her mother in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She mainly earns her income from selling vegetables. She has been in the business since 2008 and earns around 8.33 USD per day. Sengkea would like to improve her family's finances, so she has decided to take out a loan. She will use a portion of the loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell, and the rest of the loan to buy more vegetables to sell. In the future, she is going to help her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 50's, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been running two projects: a retail shop and poultry business for eight years now.  She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anna's 23rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and also started the poultry business.  She is doing great !  She appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, who can now take their kids to good schools and be self sufficient.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy shop inventory and to buy chicks for her poultry business. She dreams of living a good life and to make her business to grow.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group Mpipi, which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory and to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 30 years old, married, and supports a family of 6 members. She has been operating her retail store for the last 9 years and earns KES 15,000 per month.

Everlyne has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more stock. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals for sale in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools to enable her to dig her shamba and remove weeds which compete with her crops, so as to get better produce to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a retail shop for selling his carved items to his customers and also to get a storage space for keeping the tools and implements used while carving.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A Sra. Isabel, tem 42 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 6 filhos, dos quais 04 frequentam a escola e 02 não estudam. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o empréstimo de 8.000,00 meticais pretende comprar amendoim, arroz, feijão, sabão, recargas de mcel, vodacom e movitel, biscoitos para revender.
Ela tem o sonho de prosperar no seu negócio, aumentar a sua casa e melhorar as condições da dieta alimentar. Pese embora, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras e o seu desafio é redobrar esforços para poder reembolsar o empréstimo sem moras e solicitar o outro.
texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom attend school and two don't go to school. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
With the loan for 8,000 meticais she intends to purchase peanuts, rice, beans, soap, cookies, and cell phone recharges of various brands for re-selling.
Her dream is to succeed in her business, enlarge her house and improve her diet. However, she faces financial struggles. Her challenge is redoubling her efforts so that she can repay the loan without delinquency and apply for another one.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, rice, beans, soap, cookies, and cell phone recharges of various brands for re-selling.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
A Sra. Matilde tem 51 anos de idade, viúva, tem 06 filhos dos quais 02 estão na sua responsabilidade e os restantes 04 estão nos seus lares.  Para além dos seus filhos, tem na sua responsabilidade 04 netos que frequentam o ensino primário e 01 que é menor de idade.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar arroz, açúcar, leite, amendoim, feijão, peixe e outros produtos básicos para revender.
Sonha em ampliar seu negócio, isto é, adquirir outros produtos que não tem na sua mercearia e tem dificuldades financeiras, o que põe em causa o seu sonho. Apesar da dificuldade que enfrenta, o seu desafio é trabalhar mais para poder reembolsar o empréstimo e ceder a outro
texts.en:
Matilde is a 51-year-old widow. She has six children, two of whom are under her care and four live in their own homes. Aside from her children, she's responsible for four grandchildren who attend primary school and one who is below school age.
With the loan she intends to purchase rice, sugar, milk, peanuts, beans, fish and other essential items for re-selling.
She dreams of expanding her business, that is to say, purchasing other products that she doesn't have in her grocery store. She faces financial struggles that threaten her dream. Despite her struggles, her challenge is working harder so that she can repay the loan and apply for another one.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, peanuts, beans, fish and other essential items for re-selling.

loans.name: Kiambari Group

texts.en:
The person raising up her hand is called Esther. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 aspiring to be trained and to gain economic and social knowledge.

Esther does dairy farming to earn a living. She is applying for a loan to buy a calf to help improve milk production. This will ensure she keeps up with the high demand for milk in her locality. She hopes for more income that will be ploughed back to further expand her business. 

Esther is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy a calf that will improve milk production on maturity.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 29 years old, married and supports a family of five members. He has been operating as a dairy farmer for the last eight years and earns KES 15,000 per month.

Naftal has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demands of his clients in milk supply.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a new client to the institution. He is married with one child. He operates bar and lodge businesses. He has been in business for ten years; however, he has been affected by insufficient capital to expand his businesses. So he decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance. Johnbosco applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more drinks and beverages for his businesses so as to serve more clients. Johnbosco hopes that the financial assistance from UGAFODE will enable him to expand his business and open more outlets to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
Greda is a group consisting of six members, of whom four are men and two are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking, and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They are selling car inner tubes, tyres, sewing accessories, spare parts, kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, metal plates and body filler. 

One of the members is Emmanuel, who was selected as the featured borrower of this group. Emmanuel is a 45-year-old man living with his wife and three children, who are attending school. He runs a spare parts shop and provides a vulcanizing service. He has developed a very good relationship with his customers in the city. 

Emmanuel has a plan to make his shop bigger and keep multiple things in his shop to satisfy his customers. He also wants to purchase the items for his shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, he has requested a loan to purchase more spare parts to sell to customers, and will also use the opportunity to provide the vulcanizing service.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ester Lucia

texts.es:
Ester, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo es jornalero, tienen tres hijos, todos estudian, uno en nivel básico y los otros dos en nivel medio.

Ester, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, es una mujer de trabajo, no se rehúsa a realizar trabajos agrícolas, siempre después de terminar sus labores en casa, le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura.

Ester, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz y frijol, además comprará abono e insecticidas para preparar la tierra donde sembrará y obtener una buena cosecha.
 
El sueño de Ester, es tener un terreno propio para sembrar todos los granos básicos que necesitan, pues actualmente lo hacen en tierras alquiladas.- Ella desea dejar un patrimonio para sus hijos y ayudarles para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ester, 46, studied up to third grade. She is married, her husband is a farmworker and they have three children. All of them go to school, the youngest goes to elementary school and the other two to high school.

Ester has been a housewife all her life, but she is a hardworking woman and never refuses to do work in the farms. After finishing her duties at home, she always helps his husband with the farming.

She wishes to have their own land to grow all the basic grains they need, because they are using rented lands now. She wants to leave an estate to their children and help them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, and also fertilizers and insecticides to prepare the soil and get a good harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and farm inputs for planting so as to enable him to earn a living and meet the demands of his family out of his farm produce

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 37 years old and single.

Solita works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Solita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Solita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es:
Luis, de 49 años, inicio con su oficio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Caparrapi, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostener a sus 3 hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

En el momento en que nació su último hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día sus hijos se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de construcción para iniciar con una obra a todo costo que le generar buenos ingresos, estas herramientas básicamente serian de mano y una maquina.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a sus hijos y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Luis con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and began his own construction and repair business for homes in the town of Caparrapi.  He began the business with the goal of supporting his three children and offering them a better quality of life.  

At the moment his youngest son was born, he became motivated to work tirelessly and thus offer the best for his children's lives and development.  Today his kids have become the joy of this hard working man.

He is asking for a loan in order to purchase construction tools to begin a project at full cost and thus generate good income.  These basic tools will include hand tools and one power tool.

With this loan he will be able to support his children and his wife, giving them a better quality of life and optimal economic stability.  Help Luis with this loan so that he can continue in his work!

loans.use: To buy construction materials in order to begin a new job.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a new client to the institution. He is married with four children; three are attending school. He is a mechanic, a job he has done for over 20 years. However, he is hindered by limited capital to expand his garage. Therefore Stephen joined UGAFODE to access assistance. He applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to buy more spare parts for his business. 

Stephen thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance which has improved people's standards of living in his area and encourages UGAFODE to continue supporting low income earners.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con su esposa en una humilde finca en zona rural de Montería. 

El se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta y alterna este oficio con los jornales en otras fincas de la región.

El solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

El sueña con tener una mejor vivienda y poder garantizar la sostenibilad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is a persevering and determined man of the countryside.  He lives with his wife on a humble piece of property in the rural area of Monteria. 

He earns his living with the production, raising and fattening of pigs.  He has been doing this work for one year with the goal of obtaining sufficient resources for the maintenance of his family.

He works every day since the pigs require cleaning, food and constant monitoring for their correct development and later sale.  He alternates this work with day-labouring on the other farms in the area.

He is requesting this loan to buy pigs and feed for his animals, thus giving him the opportunity to have better-fed animals with improved conditions for consumption. 

He dreams of having a better house and to be able to guarantee the sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for his animals, giving him the opportunity to have better-fed young animals

loans.name: Ana Manuela

texts.es:
Ana ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida.

Es una mujer responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.

Ella siempre fue muy inquieta y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en una vereda del municipio de Canalete.

Hoy en día es una mujer amable y muy emprendedora, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

Ella solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como bebidas, abarrotes, granos, dulces, entre otros, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 

Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda en mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Ana has been lucky enough to have had many pleasant experiences in her life. She is responsible and well aware of the importance of family in her production process.

She was always very active and inclined to service, qualities that motivated her to set up her own grocery store and helped her make it well known in a road of Canalete district.

Now she is a kind and very enterprising woman, always looking for a wide range of high quality products to provide her customers with good service. 

She is requesting financial aid to buy assorted basic staple goods such as groceries, beverages, grains and sweets among other things. She plans to widen the range of products offered and increase her stock, so that she can meet her customers' needs.

Her biggest wish is to have a house with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of basic staple goods such as groceries, beverages, grains and sweets among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo plátano; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Los Córdobas.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de plátano.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de poder realizar el mantenimiento a sus tierras, progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a humble and hardworking farmer with the drive and determination that distinguish the men and women of the country.

He is a man with an enterprising mind. Since he was very young, he learned all the trades of the fields like farming and raising animals, so much so that today he has his own crop, the plantain, food that he sells at the marketplace in the Los Córdobas municipality. 

This person aims to increase his crops and to improve those which he currently has. This is why he is turning to Corporación Interactuar [Interactuar Corporation] for the purchase of agricultural inputs, like fertilizers and manure, and the purchase of plantain seeds. The loan will give him the chance to be able to maintain his land, to move forward as a businessman and as a person, as well as to increase his income and keep supporting his household. 

He only wants to be able to improve the quality of his life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, like fertilizers and manure, and plantain seeds.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 48 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y su pequeña bebe (Ver Foto).

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Manuel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Manuel Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Manuel is a humble and hard-working countryman who is 48 years old. Thanks to his father, Manuel learnt how to farm from a young age. 

Nowadays, Manuel has banana plantations, the crops are harvested and sold and the income generated is enough to cover daily household costs and the basic necessities of his wife and small baby (see photo). 

Manuel is seeking a loan to invest in buying wholesale agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizer and pesticides. This will allow him to keep caring for his crops and improve productivity in the next harvest, the benefits of which will be seen with each sale. 

Manuel says that his greatest desire is to keep working hard to generate a stable income and provide his family with improved living conditions. 

Manuel can provide for his family and get ahead in life with your support!

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Felicita Candelaria

texts.es:
Felicita, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es albañil, es madre de tres hijos, los tres están estudiando.

Felicita, se dedica a la sastrería desde que tenía quince años de edad, aprendió en talleres impartidos por varias ONG’S y decidió dedicarse a esto porque en su zona solo ella podía acerca de la sastrería y le llegan bastantes clientes. 

Felicita, necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de costura como botones, zíperes, péplum, adornos entre otras cosas, también le servirá para darle mantenimiento a su máquina de costurar.
 
El sueño de Felicita es, tener su propio taller de corte y confección, para poder apoyar a muchas mujeres de su cantón, para que creen una fuente de ingresos para ellas y sus familias; así también quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Felicita is 40 years old.  She studied up to the sixth grade.  She is married and her husband is a bricklayer.  She is the mother of three children, and all three are in school.

Felicita has worked as a tailor since she was fifteen years old.  She learned tailoring from various NGOs and decided to work at this because in her area she is the only one doing tailoring and she has quite a lot of clients.

Felicita needs the loan to buy sewing materials such as buttons, zippers, peplum and trim among other items. It will also be used for maintenance on her sewing machine. 
 
Felicita's dream is to have her own dressmaking workshop and be able to support many women in her canton so that they can establish a source of income for themselves and their families.  She also wants her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as buttons, zippers, peplum and trim among other items

loans.name: Clif

texts.en:
Clif is 45 years old, married and supports a family of six members. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 21 years and earns KES 12,000 per month.

Clif has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to gain more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start land rental in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk and gain more income.

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jeepneys are only seen in the Philippines. Presumably, this is the country's national transportation. Jeepneys provide a living for ordinary people like the drivers. Here is Jogie, 46, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City. She has six children and she is only one of many who oversee the operation of Jeepney units in the country. Her income from the business is a great aid for her family's daily expenses and demands.  

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid a *boundary (daily quota) each day. Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and to maintain.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Jogie is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan to buy spare parts and maintain her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living condition of her family.

In due time, she hopes that her business will be continuously operating and growing through adding more units of jeepneys. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintain her Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet the demand of her customers for milk supply.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 61 years old and married with three children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Dorothy, an ever-smiling young farmer from Nandi hills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture that it is for the older generation. She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture, she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. Dorothy passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. 

Although this humble woman has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Dorothy is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. 

Through the loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in the village of Margahovit in Lori region with her husband and two children. The entire family is involved in farming; they keep cows, sheep, calves and hens and also cultivate potatoes. 

Anahit has requested this loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and forage to feed the livestock. It will be a big help in enlarging her farm and making it more profitable. 

This is Anahit's second loan. She received her previous loan from a local financial institution, but due to difficult financial conditions was unable to repay it on time. Now, having ensured that her farming business is profitable enough to make monthly payments, Anahit applied for this loan, approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people with a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and forage to feed the livestock

loans.name: Rina Bersabe

texts.es:
Rina, es casada y madre de dos hijos con edades de 28 y 26 años, ambos no dependen económicamente de ella, su fuente de ingresos es la venta de paletas y gelatinas de sabores, sumado a ello elabora y vende pupusas desde hace 7 años, de lunes a domingo, lo hace para buscar un mejor bienestar para su familia. 
Necesita de un crédito para comprar gelatinas, paletas, quesillo, chicharrón para mantener su negocio surtido, con la inversión espera mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene en su hogar.
Su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando y ser un apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Rina is married and the mother of two children, ages 28 and 29, both of whom are economically dependent on her. Rina's source of income is the sale of fruit popsicles and gelatin desserts of many flavors. Added to this, she has been making and selling 'pupusas' (Salvadoran's favorite snack) for some seven years now. She does this seven days a week, Monday through Sunday, in quest of a better living standard for her family.

Rina needs a loan to purchase more gelatins, fruit popsicles, cheese snacks, and fried pork skins, in order to maintain her business's selection. With this investment, she hopes to improve the conditions of life they experience in their home.

Rina's objective is to keep on working and  to be a help to her family.

loans.use: buy gelatin desserts, fruit popsicles, cheese snacks, and fried pork skins, to keep her business supplied.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance services for his motorcycle and provide good transport services to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to supply more litres of milk and make tea for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal stock and a wheelbarrow for transportation.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa wants to deliver to you her heartfelt appreciation and thanksgiving for supporting her recently through a loan worth PHP 16,000. Because of this amount, she was able to improve her jeepney by buying different materials needed. As a result, she gained an increase in her income. 

This time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000. She will use this to buy additional accessories and spare parts for her vehicle. Once her income is maintained, she will be composed that her family will experience stability in everyday expenses. 

As of now, Ma. Luisa is dreaming of more units of jeepney for her business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
For five years now, Lucena has been managing and growing her own rug making business. Aside from this, she is also operating a jeepney unit. With her husband, they consolidate the businesses and their summed up income helps them to survive everyday needs and expenses. 

Having faithfully paid back her previous loan amounting to PHP 16,000 in no time. By now, she sincerely lets you know her thanksgiving for your deep-rooted generosity and kindness. 

Someday, Lucena dreams of expanding her current inventory. She also prays for more strength and blessings to continually overflow within their family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his construction site so as to employ people to work for him.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drilling machine to enable him to drill more soapstone for making several items for sale in the market.

loans.name: Beniamin

texts.en:
Beniamin is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. Beniamin now works at the city’s sport school as a coach, but he has enough time also to be busy with beekeeping. 

Now on his farm he has 100 bee families. Each season, this farmer sells a lot of honey, which his bees make of the very healing flowers, full of natural sweetness and sunshine, that grow in the pure and fresh air of this region.  

Beniamin has a great number of customers who buy from him once then never choose another farmer’s honey. Being greatly happy and satisfied of his occupation, Beniamin asks for this loan in order to enlarge the number of his bee families. With this loan amount, he will buy a lot of bee families for his farm.

loans.use: to buy a lot of bee families for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell and generate more income.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine and her family live in Vanadzor town. Currently only Heghine, her father-in-law and two children live in their house. Heghine's husband is a migrant worker and their elder son serves in the army.
 
To tackle financial hardships and be able to cover her family's daily expenses, Heghine got involved in the farming business. For already ten years, Heghine keeps livestock of cows, calves, piglets and hens. The family also cultivates haricot and potato. Because living conditions in the region where Heghine and her family live are very bad, and there is a high unemployment rate, farming income is the main source of this family's income.
 
Now, to invest in her farm and make it more sustainable, Heghine asks lenders to support her with the purchase of a cow. 

Heghine had previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Heghine has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people with a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy a cow to gather milk and dairy products for sale, so the family has income for living.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hija de 2 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Girardota, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de planchas para el cabello, secadores y esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Paola a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Paola, in her untiring search for a better life and improved economic stability for her two-year-old daughter, began a business of doing nails and hair, providing her services to homes in the municipality of Girardota.  This is a municipality where drive and determination is an important example for the inhabitants of the area.

Paola works a varied schedule every day.  She is always busy providing services since she is very much in demand due to her good work.

She is requesting economic support in order to buy hair straighteners, dryers and nail polish in different colours so that she will be able to provide better service and be able to stay afloat in her business. 

These days she feels happy for the good job that she has been doing up to now which has permitted her to have more stable work.

With a loan you will be able to help support Paola to continue with the project of life!

loans.use: to buy hair straighteners, dryers and nail polish in different colours so that she will be able to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish up his house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives with his wife and daughter in Spitak town. His only son currently serves in the army. 

David always knew he wanted to start his own business, to provide for his family normal living conditions and achieve their dreams. So since 2005, David has been running his own grocery store in the center of Spitak town. The products in his store are always fresh, and people enjoy their shopping because of his nice attitude towards them. 

David has now applied for this loan to ask lenders for support to purchase food and drink supplies for selling in the store.  He had previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, David has been able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people with a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for food and drink supplies for the store

loans.name: Adilu

texts.en:
Adilu is a repeat client of the institution. He is married with six (6) children.

He does carpentry as his major source of income; he has done this job for almost 20 years. However, he was affected by limited capital to expand his business. He decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance, which has enabled him to sustain his business. Adilu applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to boost his furniture business by buying more timber to increase his furniture production and make more profits. Adilu thanks Ugafode for financial assistance, which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet all his family financial obligations like paying tuition and expanding his business. Adilu is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Dromo Group. They are from Teshie, Accra, a city in Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who sell sewing accessories, kenkey (cooked corn paste), porridge, and underwear. 

This is their fifth loan from ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, and they are applying for a loan of GHS 5,100 in total. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Ruth is the featured leader of this group. The 38-year-old is married and a businesswoman. Together with her husband, she has four children to take care of. Ruth has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells porridge and underwear. With her share of this loan, she will buy millet to prepare porridge to sell to customers, and will also buy underwear to sell. 

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy millet to prepare porridge to sell to customers, and also buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en:
Amrah is 41 years old and married with two children. Both of his children go to school. His wife is a nurse at a local polyclinic. Amrah’s family is living at Fuzuli region, but for already 22 years they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city.

Amrah has been in an animal breeding business. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them at the bazaar to earn money. At present, he needs a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason, Amrah has applied to Komak Company. With this loan, he wants to buy more cows to increase his business.

He says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help. In the future, Amrah wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy cows and increase his business. In the future, he wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and a proud mother of three lovely children who she really adores and cherishes. It is through Mercy’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Other than doing a side hustle business, Mercy is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Mercy practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. 

Although Mercy has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 15,000 to be able to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Mercy will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Mercy will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Mercy's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, de 51 años de edad, no estudio, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen siete hijos, cuatro de ellos están estudiando y los demás trabajan.

José, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su padre, ya que era un señor muy trabajador y responsable.- Además de sembrar sus propios granos, trabaja como jornalero para otras personas, al igual que su hijo.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar malla y grapas para cercar el terreno donde sembrará su milpa, también comprará todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios.

José, siempre ha soñado con tener vaquitas, tener un terreno más grande para cultivar y ayudarle a sus hijos en sus estudios, hasta que logren graduarse de la carrera que más les guste.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, he did not study, he is married and his wife looks after the home. They have seven children, four of whom are studying with the rest working.

José has worked in agriculture all his life, everything he knows he learnt from his father, who was a very hardworking and responsible man. As well as sowing his own grains, he works as a day labourer for other people, the same as his son.

He needs the loan to buy wire mesh and clips to enclose the land where he will sow his maize, and he will also buy all the agricultural inputs necessary.

He has always dreamed of having cows, of having a larger area of land to cultivate and of helping his children in their studies until they manage to graduate in the career they like most.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh and clips to enclose the land where he will sow his maize, and he will also buy all the agricultural inputs necessary.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. She lives in Vernashen village in Vayots Dzor region with her husband and two children: a 23-year-old son and an 18-year-old daughter.
 
On her family's farm, Mariam keeps livestock including two cows, calves, pigs and hens. Mariam also owns ten colonies of bees, from which she gets very tasty and high quality honey. Her husband helps Mariam with selling the agricultural products in the market, so the family gets income for daily needs. 

Mariam has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her with farming costs. She needs to purchase two oxen and five colonies of bees for her farm to develop it. As this is Mariam's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Please help this hardworking woman to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and five colonies of bees for the farm

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en: These women are members of a group called Blema Tesa from Teshie. They are friends and live in the same neighborhood. This is the fifth time that the group has requested a loan from the field partner, ID-Ghana, in order to increase the size of their businesses. They trade in African fabric called kente and firewood. Patience is the group representative. She is 40 years old and single. Patience lives in her family house. Patience did not attend school at all. Nearly 10 years ago, she began selling firewood at her residence. This has enabled her to provide for herself without too much difficulty. Due to the high level of customer demand, Patience would like to expand her business. She has requested a fifth group loan. The previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from the financial management and enterprise development training.

He is a dairy farmer and borrowing a loan to buy dairy feeds that will enable him to increase his milk production and hence pay school fees for his two children.

Robert is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds that will enable him to increase his milk production and hence pay school fees for his two children.

loans.name: Krishnaprasad

texts.en: Krishnaprasad is 46 years old and lives in Mysore with his wife and son. After his Bachelors in Engineering, he started exploring the needs of Indian farmers. He is a dynamic person working towards the revival of traditional seeds of all kind. He is generating awareness among Indian farmers about the importance of traditional seeds and organic farming. He wants to create a model of traditional vegetables diversity center, in which he will be planting all the traditional vegetable varieties. He is seeking this loan to install watering devices, nursery beds, and isolation structures, which demarcate various varieties of seeds.

loans.use: to install nursery beds and mini sprinklers for the establishment of an indigenous seed diversity farm.

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama is married and lives in Füzuli region with her lovely family. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land of Füzuli city for 22 years. She has three children – two daughters and a son. She has a few cows. Shamama prepares dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.) and sells them in a local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money. Today, she needs 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat), because the stall for her cows is in danger of falling. She wants to repair the stall. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the help. She wants to buy a few cows and to increase her business in the future. So her monthly income will increase and she can help her children to have a good education in the future.

loans.use: to repair a stall for cows to increase business. In the future, she wants to help her children to have a good education.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en: These women are part of the Promise Group, which consists of two people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. They are selling beans, plantain, yam, lace, tops and bottoms for men, jewelries, bags and sandals. The representative for this group is named Aku. She sells tops and bottoms for males, jewelries, bags and sandals. Aku is 46 years old and she is married to an estate developer named Bismark. The couple have children, all in school, who are their dependents. Aku lives with her ​​husband and children, and handles together with her ​​husband, the various family expenditures. For the past 10 years, Aku has been running a business selling tops and bottoms for males, jewelries, bags and sandals through distribution. She buys tops and bottoms for males, jewelries, bags and sandals from the wholesale market and distribute them to customers. Seeking customer satisfaction and wanting to increase her turnover, Aku is requesting for the eighth time a loan from ID-Ghana. The previously granted loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: To buy tops and bottoms for males, jewelries, bags and sandals from the wholesale market and distribute them to customers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 25 years old, married and the father of one child who lives in Fort Portal Uganda. He operates a motorcycle transport business and supplements his income by working as a farmer. He is faced with many challenges, including poor roads that are impassable after heavy rains and competition for customers by people who are in the same business. His goal for the future is to buy more than one motorcycle so that he can increase his income. Stephen is requesting this loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Hannah, who is fifty-five years old, married, and a mother of four children. Hannah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She has benefited a lot through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, especially on financial management, as she acquired skills on prudent financial management and book-keeping. She runs her green grocer and poultry enterprise in a profitable way and also manages the income earned.

Hannah is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chicks and chicken feed to expand her poultry enterprise, which will earn her more income and in turn enable her to raise her living standards by providing quality education and better housing for her family.

Hannah is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for their assistance and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed to boost her farming, thus uplifting living standards.

loans.name: Nilza

texts.pt:
A Sra. Nilza, tem 30 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 02 filhos menores de idade. Vive na casa própria ainda em construção, com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: chapa de zinco, cimento, blocos e portas para dar a continuidade da sua obra, pois, alguns quartos estão concluidos.
Ela tem o sonho de concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura de uso pessoal e abrir uma mercearia no seu quintal. Segundo ela, a insuficiência de valores monetários constitui um obstáculo aos seus sonhos e, diz ainda que o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo de acordo com o contrato.
texts.en:
Nilza is 30 years old and married. She has two underage children. She lives in a house that she owns and it's still under construction. With the loan she intends to purchase construction supplies such as zinc plates, cement, bricks, and doors. That way she'll continue the construction work, since some of the rooms are already finished.
Her dream is to finish her house, buy a vehicle for personal use and open a grocery store in her backyard. According to her, the lack of money is an obstacle to her dreams. She also states that her challenge is paying back the loan in accordance with the contract.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as zinc plates, cement, bricks, and doors so that she can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora de 56 años que nunca se caso y vive sola, trabaja en un laboratorio clínico. Fue diagnosticada con cataratas en ambos ojos, hace 2 meses se opero su  ojo izquierdo, sin embargo su especialista le dice que es necesario y urgente que se atienda el ojo derecho ya que esto le impide tener su visión al cien por ciento, aparte de que sufre de constantes dolores de cabeza, lo que esta repercutiendo en su trabajo.
texts.en: This 56-year-old woman has never been married and lives alone.  She works in a clinical laboratory.  She has been diagnosed with cataracts in both eyes.  Two months ago, she had surgery on the left eye.  However, her specialist says that it is urgent for her to attend to the right eye since this prevents her vision from being at 100 percent.  This is also causing her to suffer from constant headaches, which is affecting her work.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina hails from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte, where she owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells basic commodities including biscuits, sugar, noodles, canned goods, condiments, beverages, and toiletries. She is a 62-year-old widow with two grown children who has been in this line of work for more than 10 years. She is asking for this loan to buy new items to sell in her store, including soft drinks, soap, beverages, and seasonings. Having these essentials in stock is very important if she wants to attract more customers and earn a greater income. Carolina would like to expand her business so that she becomes more productive and earns a higher income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in products ordered by her customers: jeans, dresses, multi-use garments, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es: Alba de 46 años de edad, es una emprendedora mujer que desde la comodidad de su hogar en Cartagena de Indias,  decidió elaborar almuerzos y ofrecerlos en venta en el año 2010, desde entonces gracias a su buena sazón, su negocio fue incrementando el número de clientes y con ello la diversidad en sus comidas; el negocio que inició como solo una venta de almuerzos hoy en día ofrece desayunos, jugos naturales, refrescos y cervezas, y ya no se encuentra ubicado en la vivienda de Alba, tuvo que mudarse a un local para adecuar su Restaurante y poder atender la demanda actual de clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceite, legumbres, azúcar y demás, así mismo realizará mejoras locativas al Restaurante. Con ésta inversión ella considera que mejorará el servicio al cliente, lo que promete que su negocio sea más atractivo para sus clientes actuales y logrará vincular nuevos. Alba está muy comprometida con su negocio porque considera que es la oportunidad de generar recursos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is a 46 year old enterprising woman who from the comfort of her home in Cartagena de Indias, decided in 2010 to make lunches and offer them for sale. Since then thanks to her good seasoning her business has been growing in the number of customers and with that the diversity of her meals.

The business that she started as the sale of lunch only today also offers breakfasts, natural juices, soft drinks and beer and no longer is located in her house. She had to move to an adequate location for her restaurant in order to take care of the demand from clients.

Now she is applying for a loan from Kiva the first loan she has made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy supplies to prepare her meals like rice, oil, vegetables, sugar and others as well as making improvements to her restaurant. With this investment she believes she will improve service to her customers which would make her restaurant more attractive to her present clients and attract new ones. Alba is very committed to her business as she thinks it is a good opportunity to generate resources and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her meals such as rice, oil, vegetables sugar and others and also make improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: Yesu Mo Group

texts.en: ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva.org in Accra, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Yesu mo Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana/Kiva lenders for a loan for GHS 2,400 to invest in their respective businesses (selling wheat flour and smoked fish). Margaret is the featured borrower in this group. She is 38 years old, married, the mother of three children and helps support her family by selling wheat flour. She has been in this business for 12 years and, with the help of this loan, will invest in her business by buying wheat flour in larger quantities to add to her current stock. She is a very hardworking woman whose goal is to build her own house. She and her children currently live with her family.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour.

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es: Magna es una mujer emprendedora de 57 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad,es socia del grupo Renovación, trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes desde hace treinta años, donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes como arroz,azúcar, leche,fideos y demás.atiende desde las 7 de mañana hasta las 9 de noche para sacar adelante a su ultimo hijo de 21 años que se encuentra estudiando en un instituto,sus principales cliente son sus vecinos y gente cercana que la conoce y ella gustosamente los atiende,Magna vive con su esposo,sus hijos y su nieto quienes la apoyan en el negocio, se siente orgullosa de pertenecer al grupo Renovación por que todos se llevan bien y se apoyan mutuamente,Magna utilizara el préstamo que Edaprospo le otorga para la compra de mercadería y Agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que la ayuda es desinteresada,"Muchas Gracias Kiva ojala muchas personas logren sus metas trazadas con la ayuda que ustedes les brindan"
texts.en:
Magna is an enterprising 57 year old woman. She is married and mother of 4 children all adults. She is a member of the "Renovación" communal bank. She has worked in a grocery store for 30 years where she sells all kinds of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, noodles and others. She works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night in order to get ahead with her last son who is 21 years old and is studying at an institute.

Her main clients are her neighbors and people who live close and know her. She happily serves them. Magna lives with her husband, her children and her grandson who help her with her store. She feels proud to be a member of the Renovación communal bank as they all get along and help each other.

Magna will use the loan that Edaprospo granted her to buy merchandise. She is grateful to Kiva to the support provided as the help is impartial. "Many thanks Kiva, hopefully many people will achieve their goals with the support that you give them".

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil and others.

loans.name: Rajabo

texts.pt:
O sr. Rajabo tem 27 anos de idade, solteiro e vive com a sua mãe. É agente da lei e ordem e estudante de Academia de Ciências Policiais. com o empréstimo, pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: cimento, area e pedra para construir-se uma casa de banho e pedra para rebocar a casa da sua mãe.
O seu sonho é concluir os seus estudos (licenciatura em ciências policiais), o seu desafio é reembolsar o crédito dentro de prazo acordado
texts.en:
Rajabo is 27 years old. He's single and lives with his mother. He's an agent for law and order and also a student at the Academy of Police Sciences. With the loan he intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand and rocks. That way he'll build a bathroom for himself and use the rocks for the walls in his mother's house.
His dream is to finish his studies (a degree in police sciences), and his challenge is paying back the loan within the agreed-upon timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand and rocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and grow more cash crops to get more income.

loans.name: Alzira

texts.pt:
A cliente Alzira de 43 anos de idade, e casada mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 3 são menores de idade e os outros 3 são estudantes do ensino secundário, vive em casa própria  e é negociante.

Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: capulanas, fraldas descartaveis,  cadeiras, biscoitos, óleo, refrescos  para ampliar o seu negocio.

Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, abrir um salão e uma barraca em casa para aumentar a renda familiar.

 As maiores dificuldades enfrentadas por ela são financeiras tem recorrido ao xitique e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Alzira is 43 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are underage and the other three are secondary school students. She lives in a house that she owns and she's a vendor.

With the loan she intends to purchase traditional skirts, disposable diapers, chairs, cookies, cooking oil, and refreshments so she can expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to meet her customers' needs. She also dreams of opening a beauty salon and a booth at her house in order to increase her family's income.

The biggest struggles she faces are financial. She has been using rotating credit, and she intends to get more loans again as a way of overcoming her struggles and achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts, disposable diapers, chairs, cookies, cooking oil, and refreshments so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
Maria tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico con sus padres y sus dos menores hijos, vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica al alquiler de video juegos en su propio domicilio, cuenta con consolas de play station las que alquila a sus clientes, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento en sus consolas de videojuegos así como para la compra de una mayor cantidad de video juegos ya que desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in the family home, made of rustic materials, along with her parents and two young boys.  She lives in the rural area of the district of Pucará, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock that is situated in the province of Jaén, the region of Cajamarca, and the northern mountains of Perú. 

She works renting video games out of her home.  She has play station consoles that she rents as well.  She has experience in the business and good personal and work references from her district.  The loan will be used to make repairs and to maintain her videogame consoles and also to purchase a larger quantity of video games since she wants to offer better service to her customers which will generate greater income and thus help her improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to make repairs and to maintain her videogame consoles and also to purchase a larger quantity of video games

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plants on the farm, in order to get better produce when harvest comes.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
A Senhora Angelina de 58 anos de idade, solteira, comerciante  mae de 9 filhos dos quais 7 são maiores de idade e independentes  e 2  frequentam o ensino primario, e tem 5 netos na sua responsabilidade, vive em casa propria.
Com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar: arroz, acucar, batata, frangos, pedacos, peixe, cerveja, cebola, pimenta, alho, para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes , e tornar se uma grande empresaria.
Os principais desafios sao financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique , e pretende tomar mais vezes para reforcar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Angelina is 58 years old and single. She's a vendor and a mother of nine children, seven of whom are independent adults and two attend primary school. She has five grandchildren under her care and she lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase rice, sugar, potatoes, chicken, fish, beer, onions, pepper, garlic and other items to stock her business.
Her dream is to expand her business so that she can meet her customers' needs and become a great businesswoman.
Her biggest challenges are financial. She has been using rotating credit and she intends to get other loans to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, potatoes, chicken, fish, beer, onions, pepper, garlic and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.en: Hudoydod is an active boy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. He is single and lives with his parents in Vahdat city. The city is attractive for tourists due to its geographical location. Vahdat is famous for its wonderful healing springs, wilderness forests, and rapid mountain rivers. Vahdat city and its surroundings are of interest primarily to hikers on mountain massifs. Hudoydod is a third-year student at University. He studies education part-time. Unfortunately, he has no money to pay his tuition fee. He wants to get education and be a specialist. He is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to pay his higher-education cost. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher-education cost

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is a 50-year-old small businessman. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Akif's family is  IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, but now they live in the Fuzuli region. Akif has a small shop. In this shop he sells various vegetables and fruits like tomato, cucumber, potato, onion, apple, etc. He has been in this business for 10 years. Today he planned to buy new seasonal fruits and vegetables. For this reason he needs 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Akif is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for a loan. He confident that this aid will help increase his business and he will earn more money. In the future he wants to repair his store for his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables. In the future he wants to repair his store for his business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 28-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a butchery and at the same time has a motorcycle transport business that supplements his incomes. He is facing challenges of poor roads that cause him constant mechanical breakdowns, which is an expense to him. However, he has future prospects of completing his house construction. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy cows for slaughtering at his butchery.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughering at his butchery

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.pt:
O senhor Arsenio  de 32 anos de idade, casado, trabalhador pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primario e um ainda e menor de idade, vive em casa propria.
Com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar: cimento, ferro, arrame, pregos, barrotes,vidros, fechaduras, e pagar a mao-de-obra para dar continuidade  da sua obra.
Tem como sonho ampliar a sua casa , casar, ver os seus filhos formados e comprar uma viatura.
Os principais desafios sao financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique , e pretende tomar mais vezes para reforcar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 32 years old. He's married and in the workforce. He has two children, one of whom attends primary school and one is below school age. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, glass, locks, and to pay for labor so he can continue the construction work.
His dream is to enlarge his house, get married, see his children graduate and buy a vehicle.
His main challenges are financial. He has been using rotating credit, and he intends to get other loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, glass, locks, and to pay for labor so he can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en: Arshak lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law in the city of Sevan, in the Gegharkunik region. Arshak and his son usually do different construction jobs in their city while their main occupation is farming. Arshak’s farm is rather cute and he has 2 cows, 2 heifers and a calf. His assortment of farm products for sale is not great: milk, macun (national dairy product) and some meat. Arshak greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle. He thinks that this is the only way can he be sure that, in the near future, his family will have a constant income and better living conditions for his future grandchildren. Arshak will use this loan amount to buy two more cows for his still cute farm.

loans.use: to buy two more cows for his still cute farm

loans.name: Ronet

texts.en: Ronet is a 30-year-old female married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  For four years Ronet has been running a retail shop with general merchandise. She began the business to support her family and supplement the little earnings from her husband. Ronet is a hardworking woman with the dream of growing her business into wholesale. In spite of this, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Ronet will use the loan to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem has successfully built her business of carpet manufacturing with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Currently she has applied a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads and wool along with packs of needles to grow her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and wool along with packs of needles to grow her sales and profits.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives with his wife and son in the Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. Many years ago, when Hayk and his wife were just married, this family established a farm.  Hayk mentions that he is very happy since his son, who is already 24 years old, also became interested in farming and gives his father a lot of help taking care of the farm’s cattle. 

Hayk has cows, calves, bulls, sheep, lambs and chickens on his farm. Hayk’s farm is rather famous in the village because of the meat he sells. He sells beef, pork, mutton and poultry mainly by order, since he has a lot of customers and sometimes the orders are so large that he hardly manages to cover all of them.

His farm’s meat is always fresh and clean, as well as his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd and eggs that his wife sells. Hayk asks for a loan of 700,000 AMD because he has plans of enlarging his farm. With the loan he is going to buy two calves for his farm and also enough fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves for his farm and also enough fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Samuni Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, 61 years old, who has six dependants. She is an active member of Samuni Women group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on savings, mobilization, and enterprise development. 

Mary practices dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed to increase milk production and earn more income to meet her basic needs, such as medical, food and clothing. Mary is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase milk production and earn more income to meet her basic needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting on her farm to get better produce when harvesting

loans.name: Paiva

texts.pt:
O Senhor  Paiva de 35 anos de idade ,casado trabalhador pai  de 2 filhos estes ainda menores de idade,  e  tem um irmão na sua responsabilidade, vive em casa propria.
