Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar: cimento, ferro, arrame, pregos, barrotes,portas, chapas de cobertura, grades para dar continuidade  da sua obra.
Tem como sonho concluir a sua casa , para oferecer um lar melhor a sua casa,comprar uma viatuar e contrair um matrimonio. 
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique , e pretende tomar mais vezes para reforcar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Paiva is 35 years old. He's married and in the workforce. He has two children who are still underage and he has a brother under his responsibility. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, doors, roof plates and railing so that he can continue the construction work.
His dream is to finish his house so he can provide a better home for his family. He also dreams of buying a vehicle and getting married.
His main challenges are financial. He has been using rotating credit, and he intends to get other loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, wire, nails, beams, doors, roof plates and railing so that he can continue the construction work.

loans.name: Johnsillas

texts.en:
Johnsillas, 58 years old, is married to Ruth and he supports 7 family members. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 30 years and it has been profitable.

Johnsillas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow for milk production and be able to meet the high demand of customers in milk supply. He hopes this will enable him to make more profits which he will use to repay the loan and expand his farming by buying farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and meet his customers' demands for milk

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is a 56-year-old single man who lives alone in the Samtredia district. He has a small agricultural activity; in particular, he harvests nuts and kiwi seasonally and sells them to the local market. Shalva lives in poverty, as he has only seasonal and insignificant income. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, he decided to expand the agribusiness with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. 

With the loan of 400 GEL, he will purchase ducks, breed them and after raising them, will sell them at a good price at the local open market. Shalva will increase the productivity with the financial support and will improve his living conditions. Shalva will be very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving him the chance to earn more income and somehow improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To breed ducks and start selling them

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: This woman was born in Zovaber village in the Gegharkunik region and now she lives here with her husband, four children (three daughters and a son) and mother-in-law. Karine is 42 years old and with her beloved husband, who is a constructor, she does farming and agriculture. On her farm, Karine has cows, sheep, lambs and chickens. She has a lot of regular customers for her farm products such as milk, curd, cheese, meat and eggs. She sells all of these right from her house. Of course land cultivation is a part of any peasant family, including Karine’s family. On her land she cultivates potatoes and a great assortment of greens, which she sells to re-sellers. Karine hopes to receive this loan as she needs to buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings and fertilizer for her land and also some fodder for all of her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings and fertilizer for her land and also some fodder for all of her farm cattle

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 59 años de edad, estudio solo hasta educación media debido a la falta de recursos económicos y también por la guerra que se vivía en el país en ese tiempo, no continuó con sus estudios superiores, está solero pero tiene 2 hijos, los cuales son mayor de edad y están casados. 

Enrique, es vendedor de medicinas, decidió dedicarse a este negocio, luego que aprendió todo acerca de esto con su tío, a quien ayudaba a vender medicinas, mientras aprendía descubrió que este negocio dejaba buenas ganancias y fue así como decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio, es un trabajo que le permite poner sus horarios y días para laborar; además de esta actividad se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más medicinas y ofrecer diferentes clases de medicamentos a sus clientes; el préstamo le ayudara a poder aumentar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.

Los sueños de Enrique son, tener su propia farmacia, además desea re-modelar su casa, pues se encuentra dañada.
texts.en:
Enrique, 59 years old, studied only up to high school due to a lack of financial resources. Also, because of the war present in the country at that time, he did not continue his higher studies. He is single but has 2 children which are adults and married.                

Enrique is a medicine seller. He decided to make a living in this business after he learned everything about this with his uncle, whom he helped by selling medicines. As he was learning, he found out this business yielded good earnings; that is how he decided to become independent and have his own business. It is a job that allows him to establish his own hours and days to work. In addition to this occupation, he plants staple grains like corn and beans.                   

He needs the loan to buy more medicines and to offer different kinds to his customers. It will help him to be able to increase his business and obtain better earnings.

Enrique's dreams are to have his own pharmacy; also, he wishes to remodel his house, since it is damaged.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and offer different kinds to his customers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.pt:
A senhora Rosita e casada mae de 6 filhos dos quais 3 ja sao maiores de idade vivem em sua casa, e frequenta o ensino primario  e 2 o ensino secundario, vive em casa propria.
Com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar: acucar, feijao, oleo, amendoim, cerveja, refresco, sabao, vinhos para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades do seu negocio e comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no seu dia-a-dia.
Os principais desafios sao financeiros tem recorrido ao xitique , e pretende tomar mais vezes para reforcar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Rosita is married and has six children. Three of her children are already adults and have their own homes, one attends primary school and two attend secondary school. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she intends to purchase sugar, beans, cooking oil, peanuts, beer, refreshments, soap, and wine to stock her business.
Her dream is to expand her business so that she can meet her customers' needs and buy a vehicle to help her with daily chores.
Her main challenges are financial. She has been using rotating credit, and she intends to get other loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, cooking oil, peanuts, beer, refreshments, soap, and wine to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and increase business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a smallholder farmer based in Lelwak village in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She owns a piece of land where she grows maize and keeps three dairy animals. Pauline has also planted 200 trees on her land for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business, but also a home for her family. Pauline is blessed to have four children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for 28 years! 

Pauline is seeking a loan to purchase cereals to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Nandi Hills, only a few kilometers from Pauline’s home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. Pauline is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Pauline’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she had.

loans.use: To purchase cereal seeds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 35 years old, is married to James and supports a family of 6 members. She has been in the farming business for the last 15 years.

Grace has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. This will enable her to increase her milk production to supply milk to her customers and, hopefully, to earn more income. Grace plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to buy more dairy cows, make more income and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and increase her milk production and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pawpaw seedlings for transplantation, hoping to earn a living from them after sale of pawpaw fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice for selling.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo, to grow her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, to grow her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida  is 42 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of eight children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years with the support of her husband. 

Shahida is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more animals for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 50 years old, married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand EA to benefit from the training on enterprise development and financial management.

He is a dairy farmer and supplies fresh milk in his neighborhood and nearby market. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy cattle feed to increase milk production and hence meet customers' demands.

Philip is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle feed to help  increase milk production and meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Assma

texts.en:
Assma, 31 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Assma  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply her cafe with milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and to use farm manure made in her farm for better agricultural produce.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is a hard-working married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing their stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their seven children. 

Currently, Razia requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 47 years old and he lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. He has higher agronomic education, so being engaged in farming is just to work in his specialty. Gagik works at a private company now, but his main time is spent in his farm taking care of his land and farm cattle. In his farm Gagik has 2 cows, 3 calves and a pig. From his land he gathers a perfect harvest of potatoes, greens, tomatoes and cucumbers. Thanks to his own knowledge and its right usage during his work, Gagik manages to have not small income from his farm for his family. 

Gagik also has a tractor on which he manages his agricultural work, and he also takes orders to do work with it on his neighbors’ lands, which is also a rather profitable occupation for him. Gagik is married and he has two daughters and a son. He will be happy to have this loan as his tractor needs to be repaired and he must buy some new spare parts for it.

loans.use: to repair his tractor and to buy some new spare parts for it

loans.name: Jelliah

texts.en:
Jelliah is 59 years old, married, and she supports six family members. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 21 years and  it earns her a monthly income of KES 17,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy a dairy cow for milk supply for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be a large-scale farmer in the region. 

Her future hope and dream is to supply more dairy products in the market.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs for high production for more income gain.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old and a proud mother of four lovely children, whom she really adores and cherishes. It is through Ruth’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Other than doing a side business, Ruth is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past three years. She has gained much experience through those years of farming. 

Ruth practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. Although Ruth has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. 

Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 15,000 to be able to buy cereals for resale. The Nandi Hills area has a ready market for cereals but the major problem that she faces is lack of supply. With the loan she will be able to meet the demand for cereals that exists in her area and this will translate to increased income. 

Ruth’s dream is to be the lead supplier of cereals in her village. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona, who is a 26-year-old married woman, lives in Batumi city. She has a son and a husband who is temporarily unemployed. The family members live in poverty, as they have no source of income to satisfy even their basic needs. Teona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of no income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Teona plans to open a fast food cafe, where she will produce traditional Georgian and Turkish dishes.  As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family will get the only source of income and will tackle the poverty. Teona will be able to create better living conditions for her son.

loans.use: To open a fast food cafe and earn the only source of income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tyres and oil for maintenance purpose and meet the demands of his clients in transportation services.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is very thankful for her first Kiva loan which developed her trading business. She hopes that she can again be supported by Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon. Marieta lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region with her husband, student daughter and son. Her husband and son are farmers. She still manages her trading business at the rented stall. Marieta and her husband do their best to provide their family with good living conditions, but since their daughter is a student at the paid division of Vanadzor State University at the faculty of History, now it is a great financial hardship for her family also to pay for her education. Marieta asks for this loan of 200,000 AMD as she must pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Phoebe has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is 53 years old. She lives with her 27-year-old son who is a taxi driver and her 24-year old daughter who is an accountant in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Marine has a higher pedagogical education and a specialty of teacher. Being greatly devoted to her beloved profession, Marine has already worked in this field for 25 years. At the local school she works as a teacher of physics. She also gives paid private courses at her house preparing pupils for the entrance exams. Marine is a beloved teacher, and thanks to her patience and love toward the children, her pupils usually mange to have good results both at the school and at the exams. She asks for this loan because she very much wants to buy a computer and also professional literature which she uses a lot in her pedagogical activities at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified seeds for planting

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Currently she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more stock of grains, sugar and biscuits along with cleaning products, to grow her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grains, sugar and biscuits along with cleaning products, to grow her sales and profits.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: 50-year-old Maia lives in the village of Nasaguri. She is married, has four children and five grandchildren. She supports her big family by looking after the grandchildren and doing farm work on a small scale. The vegetables she grows and the few cows and sheep she keeps are mainly for their own usage. But sometimes she sells milk and cheese to earn additional income.Maia will use the loan to buy four milk cows.

loans.use: to buy four cows for her family's own usage and for selling milk and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply her cafe with milk

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Naheed is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and blankets for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy bundles of bed sheets and blankets in different colors and designs. It will help her to inflate her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and blankets in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a forty year old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices the rearing of cows and goats alongside farming where he gets his extra income. With this, he has been able to develop himself and sustain his family. He hopes to expand his farm, however his main challenges are diseases that attack his animals and inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs so as to increase her agricultural produce for sale in the market and meet the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost his banana trade

loans.name: Nhóm 09-Khu Phố 14-Ngọc Trạo Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huề works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Huề is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Bim Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

Huề has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is the group leader of Nhóm 09-khu phố 14-Ngọc Trạo group. The main hardship that Huề faces is lack of capital. With her business profits, Huề hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth, living in Fort Portal, Uganda, is a 33 year old married lady with two children. She has a business of selling motorcycle spare parts and at the same time sells produce. She is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinders the progress of her business. However, she is working very hard to expand her business to new areas in order to yield more income. Beth has asked for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is 23 years old, a single woman. She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. The man shown in the photo is her brother. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then sells it to the people in her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Anam  has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 49 years old, widowed and lives in Tsalka with her daughter. Her primary job is at the social service agency. She is a small farmer on the side. She has good experience in keeping cows and there is still plenty of space in the barn, so she decided to buy two more cows. She chose a Dutch cattle breed, which matches the climate in Georgia very well and is good for both milk and beef production.

The main motivation for Maia's agricultural activity is food security. If you buy animal products at a Georgian market place, there is always the risk of bad quality or even harmful contamination. Keeping her own cows, Maia is sure to have healthy foodstuffs for herself, her daughter and other relatives.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to have healthy food for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut paste and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production and make farm manure from cow dung, which he will use to improve his agricultural produce.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en: Bano is 48 years old and a married lady. She is a very talented lady and excels at her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. Now she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for making more dresses on time. This gives a boost in her earnings and she wishes to spend it on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for making more dresses on time

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Tuğba

texts.en:
Tuğba is married and the mother of two children.  To supplement her husband’s income, she began selling dishes (plates, silverware, pots, and glassware) at the local market one day a week.  Later she expanded her business.  

Now she sells in the market every day and has a store.  She is both a young entrepreneur and an employer, with two employees.  With her loan from Maya, she’ll buy products wholesale, which will increase her profit margin, both for her stand in the market and her store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Tuğba Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Tuğba Hanım eşine destek olmak için önce hafta da bir gün semt pazarına giderek züccaciye satışı (tabak, çatal, kaşık, tencere, cam eşya vs. ) yapmaya başlamış.  Daha sonraki dönemlerde işini geliştirmiş.  Şimdi haftanın her günü semt pazarlarında satış yapan Tuğba hanımın çarşı merkezde de bir zücaciye dükkânı var.  Hem genç bir girişimci hem de bir işveren olan Tuğba Hanım yanında iki kişi çalıştırıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı krediler ile hem dükkânına hem de pazardaki tezgâhlarına toptan ürün aldı ve kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy home products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow for milk production and increase the number of litres of milk supplied to her customers daily.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 47 years old and a married woman, the mother of 5 children. She has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale for many years. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life through her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, de 41 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes y los otros tres viven con ella.

Ana, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos; en época de cortar café trabaja en una finca, mientras que su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa desempeñando diferentes actividades, su lugar de trabajo está a 1 hora de su casa, pero les brindan transporte.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz para sembrar, comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para realizar dicha labor.

El sueño de Ana, es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 41 years old, did not go to school. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. Two of them are already independent, and the other three live with her.

Ana does the household tasks and takes care of her children. In the season for picking coffee, she works on a farm, while her husband works in a cooperative, doing many different tasks. Her place of work is an hour from her house, but they offer them transportation.

Ana needs the loan to buy corn seeds to plant, to buy agricultural supplies, and to pay for labor to do this work.

Ana's dream is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant, buy agricultural supplies, and pay for labor to do this work.

loans.name: Kitheuni Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Patrick, a member of Kitheuni SHG group. He is fifty nine years old, married and a father of five children.

The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014, and members underwent training on group formation, saving and resource mobilization, enterprise development, financial management, and value addition and market linkage. They have benefited a lot through the training as they acquired skills on better saving methods and started saving individually through HiH EA branded piggy banks. 

Patrick does poultry keeping.He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chickens and chicken feeds to expand his poultry enterprise and thus increase his sales turnover. He intends to use the profits to buy a goat and uplift his living standards, such as having better clothing and quality medical care for the family.

He is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for the assistance and promises to repay well.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds that will boost farm ouput.

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Muuini W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Veronicah, 42 years old and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the enterprise development training.

She is practicing farming growing kale; she is borrowing to buy manure which will help her increase production of kale and hence earn more income which will assist her meet the rising demand of kale in the market.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure which will help her increase production of kale, and hence earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mining tools and equipment for her to mine more soapstones for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Gino Noel

texts.es:
Gino tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Zaña una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila ya que es una comunidad rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con una mayor diversidad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ventas que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gino is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and minor son in the district of Zaña, a community where life is peaceful, since it is a rural community where the people work in agriculture and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He raises and sells small animals such as pigs, hens, chickens, and ducks, among others. He has more than five years of experience in the business and has good references on the part of the people of his district. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of a larger quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them. This investment will serve him to be able to provide his customers with a greater variety of animals, which will generate greater sales for him, which are going to allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Misakwani Small Farmers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Bines. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in year 2013 to benefit from savings mobilization and enterprise development training.

She operates a grocery shop selling fruits and vegetables. She is borrowing a loan to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to add stock to her grocery shop and meet her customers' demands. With the increased income, she will be able to cater for her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Bines is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her grocery shop and meet her customers' demand hence cater for her family's needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La Señora trabaja en el mercado central de su municipalidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ensaladas de frutas, jugos, refrescos, entre otros productos, atiende personalmente de lunes a domingo en un puesto que le otorgó la alcaldía. Estudió hasta el nivel primario y tiene dos hijas, una de ellas es independiente mientras la otra se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Sin embargo, la suya es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos. El trabajo de la señora es muy cansador, ya que ella tiene que salir en las madrugadas al mercado para alistarse y vender día a día. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y producción de flores en una comunidad alejada del área urbana y con los ingresos de ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijas. Lamentablemente, su esposo enfermó y se encuentra muy delicado de salud y necesita una operación de urgencia para recuperarse, por esta razón la señora solicita una ayuda económica para poder cubrir los gastos de operación, para así poder salir de esta situación y su esposo pueda trabajar en sus labores y ambos aspiren a un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
This woman works in the central market of her town. She sells fruit salads, juices, and soft drinks, among other products. She works there personally from Monday to Sunday in a stall that the municipality granted her. She went to school through the primary level and has two daughters. One of them is independent, while the other one is studying at the university. Nevertheless, hers is a humble family of scarce economic resources.

This woman's work is very tiring, since she has to go out to the market in the early morning to get ready and sell every day. Her husband works in agriculture and the production of flowers in a community away from the urban area, and with the income of both they make an effort to get ahead and offer a better future to their daughters.

Unfortunately, her husband became ill and is in very delicate health and needs an urgent operation in order to recover. For this reason, the woman is applying for economic help to be able to cover the expenses of the operation to thus be able to get out of this situation so that her husband can work at his job and both can aspire to a better future for their family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of an operation for her husband, who is sick. In this way, the man can resume his activities and will be able to continue working for the well-being of his family.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is a loving mother of three and a very hardworking entrepreneur from Payatas, Quezon City. She is 39 years of age and married to Ronnie, a carpenter, and they are helping each other to provide for the everyday needs of their family. 

She mainly offers broom reeds and rugs, which she is weaving with her bare hands. The rugs she makes range from round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats. As rugs and brooms are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, these are the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1500 in sales every week.

Roxanne is taking out a PHP 35,000 loan to buy raw supplies and materials needed in making more rugs. She will be also utilizing the loan to buy more broom reeds to increase her product inventory.

In the future, Roxanne hopes that she will have her own space to store all her products and which will also serve as her workplace for making rugs. She also looks forward to seeing their lives prosper. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw products she needs to make more rugs that she sells and additional broom reeds which she also trades.

loans.name: Baburyeli

texts.en:
Baburyeli was able to buy more cattle for fattening and also added some chicks in his poultry farm. He is a 70-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening and selling, alongside poultry farming. He started this business to earn more income and have a better standard of living. He has the hardships of bad weather, chicken pox, and dry seasons that affected his cows. He still has a vision of increasing the size of his farm. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy more chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Titus is a married man with three children. He has been in the informal settlement for almost ten years now. He learned of Fresh Life through a relative who is an operator. He developed an interest and now wants to run a toilet like his relative, who has been very successful.

He is planning to install Fresh Life Toilets in a densely populated area and anticipates making some good returns from this venture.
 
Titus also runs a motor bike business, popularly known as "bodaboda", which earns him substantial income.
He also plans to use income to develop a plot which he acquired some years back and has been unable to develop.

loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk supply for more income gain

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with nine children. Three of her children are in school.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from bicycle taxi.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: V. V.  Nicole Hortense

texts.fr:
41 ans, mariée, Nicole a trois enfants âgés de 18, 14 et 7 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée.
Achat et revente de chaussures à l'occasion est l'activité, source de revenu de Nicole. Elle a démarré en 2006, ce qui lui fait 9 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine.  Elle et son mari y travaillent ensemble. Ils sont très solidaire. Elle a commencé à faire de la vente en détail et actuellement elle effectue des demi-gros.
Avec les gains de cette activité, elle a pu beaucoup épargne et avec lequel la famille a pu construire leur propre maison.
Elle désire devenir grossiste et posséder plusieurs point de vente, augmenter le revenu pour pouvoir continuer à scolariser ses enfants, les faire réussir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Nicole is 41 years old, married, and has three children aged eighteen, fourteen and seven. All three attend a private school.
                      
Nicole’s revenue-generating business is the purchase and resale of used shoes. She started in the business in 2006, giving her nine years of experience in it. She and her husband work at it together. They are very cooperative. She started by retailing, and now sells semi-wholesale. With the profits from this business, she was able to save a lot, and the family could build their own house.
                      
She wants to become a wholesaler and own several retail locations. Increasing revenues will allow her to keep her children in school and help them succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of second-hand shoes (sneakers and boots).

loans.name: Jamiru

texts.en:
Jamiru is a married man, 32 years of age, living in a rural area with his family of 3 children. 1 attends school. He has retail shop and produce business. He started this business in 2010 and has gradually expanded and delved into other projects such as coffee growing.
He works 7 days in a week, 13 hours per day. He acquired this loan to add stock and boost his retail shop. He will buy items such as sugar, utensils, rice, soap, bread, biscuits among other items to sell. He has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around. His clients are local people from the surrounding area.
The challenges he faces are price fluctuations of some commodities. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, utensils, rice, soap, bread, biscuits among other items to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal care products. Jovita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell

loans.name: Kader

texts.en:
Kader is 18. She is working to put herself through school.  She sells multi-level marketing beauty products, a job she started to buy them for herself at a lower price.  Then she began selling to her friends and neighbors.  With the loan from Maya, she’ll order the products wholesale at a lower rate.  In the future, she wants to finish school so she can have a career.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Kader hanım 18 yaşında.  Hem okuluna devam ediyor hem de kendi harçlığını çıkarıyor.  Network sistemiyle güzellik ürünleri satan Kader Hanım bu işe ilk önce kendi kişisel ihtiyaçlarını daha ucuza almak için girmiş.  Daha sonra arkadaşlarına ve çevresine satış yapmaya başlamış.  Mayadan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün siparişi vererek ürünleri daha ucuza aldı ve kar oranını artırdı.  Gelecekte okulunu bitirerek iyi bir meslek sahibi olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante con con su esposo y sus 2 hijos,trabaja alquilando su cochera 
y ayudando a su esposo en el negocio de ferretería desde hace 9 años,del cual se siente muy orgullosa de atender a sus clientes por el trato directo y amable que tiene hacia ellos,Ana se siente contenta de pertenecer al grupo Santa Rosa de Lima ya que son muy unidos,y agradece el préstamo otorgado por Edaprospo ya que le ha permitido poder comprar mercadería como fierro, cemento,arena y demás,para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y así poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia, Ana agradece a losa inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda que siempre les brinda a pesar de no conocerla.
texts.en:
Ana is a tenacious woman that has learned how to succeed with her husband and her two children.  She has worked renting out her garage and helping her husband in the hardware store business for nine years.  She feels very proud of this and of her service to her clients, because of the direct, friendly treatment she gives them.

Ana feels happy to belong to the Santa Rosa de Lima group, because they are very united, and she is grateful for the loan granted by Edaprospo.  It has allowed her to be able to buy merchandise such as iron, cement, sand, and so on, and to be able to continue growing her business, and thereby give better quality of life to her family.  Ana is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help that they always give her, even though they don’t know her.

loans.use: to buy hardware merchandise, such as iron, cement, spare parts, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal for his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Huriye

texts.en:
Huriye is married and the mother of two children.  Her husband is a teacher, and to add to the family income, Huriye also wanted to find a job.  

She learned one of her friends wanted to sell a spice shop.  She decided she could do that job and bought the shop.  Since then she has been running the spice shop.  

This will be her third loan.  She used a loan in winter to buy spices such as linden that are good for winter illnesses.  In summer she’ll use the loan to buy weight loss spices. 

Buying seasonal products wholesale has helped her increase her sales.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Huriye hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi öğretmen olan Huriye Hanım evin giderlerine destek olmak için iş aramaya başlamış.  Bu dönemde bir arkadaşlarının baharatçı dükkânını devir edeceğini duymuş.  Ben bu işi yapabilirim demiş ve dükkânı devir almış.  O günden beri küçük baharat dükkânında baharat satışı yapıyor.  Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Huriye hanım mevsimine göre toptan baharat alımı yaptı.  Kışın çektiği kredi ile ıhlamur gibi kış hastalıklarına iyi gelen baharatları aldı.  Yaz döneminde çektiği krediyle de zayıflamaya yardımcı baharatlar aldı.  Toptan ve mevsimine uygun aldığı baharatlar sayesinde satışlarını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy weight loss spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rices, sugar, flour, vegetable oil, soap, legumes, dried fish, and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for service and maintenance of his motorcycle to enable him meet the demands of his customers in transport services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a retail shop for selling his curved items to his customers and also a store for keeping the tools and implements used while curving.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 27 years old and married, and he supports four family members. He has been operating an outside cafe for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Douglas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to construct a shade for his clients. He plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be a large scale farmer. 

His future hopes and dreams are to supply large farm products to the market.

loans.use: To construct a shade for his clients.

loans.name: Ömür

texts.en:
Ömür is 47 and the mother of two children.  After the death of her husband, she began selling manti (Turkish ravioli), pasta, and tarhana (preserved yogurt soup) to put her daughter through school in another city.  At first she sold to her friends and neighbors, then began selling from a stand to pay for her daughter’s education expenses.  

This will be her second loan.  She’ll use it to purchase flour, ground beef, and the ingredients for tarhana wholesale.  This helps her increase her profits.  In the future she wants to both sell these products and open a place to sell them hot.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Ömür hanım 47 yaşında ve iki çocuk annesi.  Eşinin ölümünden sonra kızını şehir dışında okutmak için mantı, makarna, tarhana yaparak bu ürünlerini satmaya başlamış.  Önce çevresine satış yapmış daha sonra stantlarda satış yaparak kızının okul harçlıklarını çıkarmış.  Ömür hanım mayadan 2. kredisini kullanıyor.  Mayadan aldığı krediler ile toptan un, kıyma ve tarhana malzemesi aldı.  Böylece kar oranını artırdı.  Gelecekte bu ürünlerinin hem satışını yapacağı hem de sıcak servinin yapıldığı bir işletme açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a smallholder farmer, who was born and raised in the Nandihills area of Kenya, where the land and family are part of your life, and you live for the land and the land lives for you. She is blessed with a lovely family, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, Mercy grows maize, has a dairy cow, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize, and when she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the meager income she earns. However, despite the meager earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products, because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. Although she earns profits through farming Nandihills has one problem and that is low supply of cereals. Mercy wants to capitalize on this and be a large cereal supplier. She is kindly requesting for a loan to buy cereals for resale. Through the loan she will be able to satisfy the market and this will improve her income levels. With this loan, Mercy is going to grow into a very successful cereal seller. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 60 year old woman, from Kutaisi city, west Georgia. She has 2 sons, who have their own activities, daughter-in-law, who works as an operator at the financial institution, and 2 grandchildren. Marina is also employed and works as a baker, where she gets 450 GEL. She is eager to have her own business and make her work more productive. Now she needs financial support to purchase all equipment and working materials for opening a cafe in Kutaisi, that will have a great location and will get many customers. The cafe Marina is going to open, has branches through the country and has it's own loyal costumers. Marina will work there herself and will also have stuff to make it a more comfortable and desired place for local and passer-by people as well.  
This financial support is very important for Marina, as her income will significantly increase and she will satisfy family's increased needs. Marina will be very thankful for the loan and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: To open a cafe and have her own business income

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es:
Melfy es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 14, 10, 8 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de salteñas y tamales.
Ella es buena madre, constante, independiente,  responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área residencial y muy poblada, casas antiguas y rústicas,  muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos, conviven formando un lugar de comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. Los suelos de esta parte son predominantemente arenas; finas y otras limosas,  de clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Melfy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español y habla guaraní por herencia familiar (sentada al centro, viste blusa y falda negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a su necesidad de superación reunió una banca de personas con necesidades similares y negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras y venta de helado, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la panadería, y sus variedades más comunes son las salteñas y tamales. Las salteñas son un tipo de empanada jugosa y rellena generalmente con carne de res o de pollo, huevo duro, especias, y otros ingredientes, cocida al horno, típica en la gastronomía popular y se sirve a media mañana. Por las tardes se ocupa de la venta de tamales, que son; horneados de choclo molido con queso existen con ají y dulces, comúnmente se acostumbre a comerlas por la tarde acompañada de un café, “aprendí a hornear por herencia, sé otras recetas pero por el momento con estas 2 me va bien…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la costumbre de los pobladores de comer ambas comidas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para aumentar la producción. Su sueño es tener una panadería amplia y surtida. Ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes harinas (trigo, maíz, arroz, etc.) por mayor, para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que lleva como panadera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Melfy solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor para aumentar su producción y llegar a más clientes mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Melfy is a 32-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, and she has 4 children, ages 14, 10, 8 and 5. Her business is selling salteñas [a meat filled empanada] and tamales. She is a good mother, and she is consistent, independent, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the southern zone of the city. It is a residential area, densely populated, with old, rustic houses, many of which are without access to basic services.  They live side by side, forming a place for business and all areas of manufacturing. The lands in this area are predominantly composed of sand, some fine and others muddy. The climate is warm, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Melfy has tan skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears tied back. She is short of stature, with a robust build. Her maternal language is Spanish, and she speaks Guaraní by family heritage. She is seated in the center, wearing a black blouse and skirt.  She shares her life with her partner, a businessman, and her children, who are studying in school. They live in their own house, made of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

Her need to succeed was the reason that she brought together a bank of persons with similar needs and businesses, such as sales of cell phone covers, coca leaf, quinoa juice, perfume, soft drinks, skirts, and ice cream. Their purpose is to request a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her business is baking, mostly salteñas and tamales. Salteñas are a type of empanada—juicy, and filled with beef or chicken, hard-boiled egg, spices, and other ingredients, and cooked in the oven. They are a traditional popular cuisine, and are served mid-morning.  In the afternoon, she is busy selling tamales, which are baked ground corn, with cheese, peppers and sweets. These are customarily eaten in the afternoon, accompanied by a cup of coffee. “I learned to bake through heritage. I know other recipes, but for the moment, these two are going well for me…” she says. 

The advantage of her business is the people’s custom of eating both foods; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of wholesale cooking supplies in order to increase production. 

Her dream is to have a large, well-stocked bakery. She wants to purchase different flours (wheat, corn, rice, etc.) at wholesale, in order to increase her production and improve her income. This is the second loan cycle in the one year that she has been an independent baker. 

That is why Melfy is requesting a loan for the purchase of wholesale flour to increase her production and reach more customers, thus improving her income.

loans.use: to purchase flour at wholesale, in order to increase her production and reach more customers, thus improving her income.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana, who is 25 years old young woman, lives in Kutaisi city. She has husband and 4 year-old son. Ana is the only breadwinner in the family, and gets a small income from working as a private teacher. She trains children at home in English language. However, the family has unstable financial condition and requires an additional source of income. Ana decided to start other activity and requested a loan. She lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Ana to get a loan of 950 USD and purchase a sewing machine. Ana will start working at the local sewing workshop as a tailor. After this starts, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With support of the Start Up program Ana will get an opportunity to generate additional income and tackle with the financial difficulties. Ana awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine and start working as a tailor

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino, who is a 40 year old married woman, from the village Dzimiti, living with her husband and son. The family members don't have any stable jobs and the only source of income is from a small agribusiness. With the help of her husband, Nino cultivates a plot of land, harvests nuts and maize and sells the products at the local market. However the income mostly is a seasonal and Nino wants to be involved in other business also. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, she decided to start clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Nino’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the received money, she will purchase stock of various kind clothing and home products also and will sell in her community at increased prices. She will be able to generate income after the season also and tackle with the financial difficulties. The family members will be very thankful for the support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and start trading

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow cow for milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame Group

texts.en:
These members live in Chorkor, a neighborhood of Accra, and they know each other as neighbors. The group members work as vendors, selling frozen food, spare parts, and electrical parts. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana and are now on their fourth loan cycle.

Kofi is well-known in the entire neighborhood as a vendor of high-quality car spare parts. He plans to use his loan to buy car spare parts from wholesale market in Kaneshie-Accra. The spare parts will be sold to customers. 

He promises to be ever ready to retail to a customer base composed mainly of car owners and mechanics. With this loan, Kofi hopes to earn a good monthly revenue, which will be reinvested in his business. Hhe is  33 years old and lives with his wife and two children.

The group members need a total amount of GHS 5,900 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts from the wholesale market in Kaneshie-Accra.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more underwear and second hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production and make farm manure from cow dung

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael Antonio es un joven estudiante de Ingenieria en Sistemas, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Rafael, tengo 18 años, tengo 3 hermanos, soy soltero y no tengo hijos. Vivo con mi abuelo materno, ya que mi madre falleció cuando nací y desde entonces mis abuelos me han criado. 
Actualmente estudio Ingeniería en Sistemas en la Universidad O&M; elegí esta carrera porque desde pequeño siempre me gustaba la tecnología de ver como a través de los años mejoraba cada vez más y hasta un punto de querer se parte de la próxima generación de personas que cambiaran el mundo.

Actualmente estoy en el primer cuatrimestre  escolar, mis materias favoritas son Introducción a la Informática e introducción a la Matemática. 
Estoy solicitado este préstamo para mis estudios ya que a mi nivel es difícil conseguir un empleo y progresar académicamente. Mi padre tiene otra familia que mantener y actualmente no tiene un trabajo fijo, por eso mi vida académica se ha vuelto más complicada. Este préstamo me ayudaría a lograr mi sueño, sería un gran impulso para mí. No quiero dejar de estudiar en ningún momento, por eso solicito su ayuda para lograr ser un profesional. 
Mi objetivo es prepararme y llegar a mi mayor promedio académico posible. Quiero trabajar en un compañía grande, quiero ser un ejemplo de que querer es poder y que cualquiera puede superar la adversidad, quiero ayudar a mi abuelo y a toda mi familia.
texts.en: Rafael Antonio is a young Systems Engineering student. He is requesting a loan to pay for his education expenses. This is his story: "My name is Rafael. I am 18 years old and I have three siblings. I am single, without children. I live with my maternal grandfather, because my mother died when I was born, and ever since then, my grandparents have raised me up. Currently, I am studying Systems Engineering at the "Universidad O&M". I chose this career, because since I was very young, I always liked technology and I saw myself getting better every day, and to the point of wanting to be part of the next generation of persons who would change the world. Currently, I am in my first four month semester of college. My favorite courses are "Introduction to Computers" and "Introduction to Mathematics". I am requesting this loan for my studies, because at my level, it is difficult to find a job and progress academically. My father has another family to support and currently, he does not have a regular job; therefore, my student life has become more complicated. This loan would help me achieve my dream; it would be a boost for me. I do not want to stop studying at any time. Therefore, I am requesting your help to be able to become professional. My objective is to prepare myself and achieve my greatest possible academic average. I want to work in a big company. I want to be an example of achieving what one really wants, and that anyone can overcome obstacles. I want to help my grandfather and my whole family."

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carving tools and equipments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and other farm inputs like fertilizers for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stocks in her business for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and use its dung as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal stocks and to build shade for marketing his products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for planting her seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 54 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Catalina se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno, producción y venta de leche, además de venta de animales menores como carneros, pavos, patos y cuyes, tiene más de 16 años de antiguedad en el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Catalina solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para todo su ganado, de esta manera ella espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old, and she lives with her children in a small community in the rural zone of Cayaltí. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. The population of Cayaltí works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. Cayaltí is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast. 

Catalina works raising cattle, and in the production and sale of milk, in addition to selling small animals such as sheep, turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs. She has been working more than 16 years in the business, which is located at her own home. 

Catalina is requesting a loan for the purchase of balanced fattening feed for all of her livestock. In this way she hopes to make her business grow, and be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced fattening feed for all of her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming tools to increase production.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 54 years old and widow. She works hard to provide for herself. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like soap, sugar, canned goods and other personal care products.

Marjorie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marjorie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, sugar, canned goods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 43 years old, married and supports eight family members. For the last 22 years, he has earned a living by selling cereals. He earns about KES 13,000 a month, and is requesting a loan for KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more cereals to sell. He plans to use the profits he expects to earn to repay this loan and educate his children. His goal for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro Labrador Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO LABRADOR, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juana tiene 65 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio  de compra y venta de frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank San Isidro Labrador. The bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which is in the La Convencion province in the Cusco department.

Juana is 65 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities, making a living by buying and selling fruits such as bananas and oranges, among others. She has been in this business for a while, and it’s going well for her thanks to the determination that she applies to her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy fruit.

The members are thankful for the loan they are being given and they promise to make the established payments. The member who is seen in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

People who are older than 65 years of age are excluded from the formal financial system. Thanks to the Kiva lenders, they can obtain financing. Therefore, the member promises to make her loan payments on the established due dates.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy balanced feed to fatten them

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice lives in the Nandihills area of Kenya, which renowned for rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. She is the mother of five children and has worked in agriculture for the last 10 years. She earns most of her income from farming and from producing milk, but the rising costs of farm supplies such as fertilizer, combined with fluctuations in market prices, present her with serious challenges that significantly cut into her profits. Despite these tough conditions, Eunice remains positive and passionate about her work. She is seeking a loan to buy more land so that she can increase her output and make more profit. This will also allow her to tackle high farm-related costs coming up next season by producing more and higher-quality products.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to her customers.

loans.name: Antonio Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, no tiene hijos biológicos, pero su compañera de vida tiene dos hijos, a los cuales él le ayudo a crecerlos y ahora ellos están en el extranjero y les ayudan económicamente, en su casa solo vive él y su pareja.

Enrique, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 6 años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque vio que generaba buenos ingresos y estos le permitirían ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
 
Enrique, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca preñada, para incrementar su hato de ganado y la producción de leche, ya que vende productos lácteos.

Enrique, desea quiere un crédito más grande y en un futuro aumentar su ganado y la producción de leche para expandirse en la comercialización de lácteos.
texts.en:
Enrique, 64, studied through sixth grade.  He lives with his partner. He does not have biological children, but his life-companion has two children whom he helped to raise. Now they are abroad, and they help them financially. Only he and his partner live in their house. 

Enrique has been working in agriculture and livestock-raising for six years; he decided to work in this business because he saw that it generated good income, which would allow him to help with the household expenses. 

Enrique needs the loan to purchase a pregnant cow in order to increase his small herd of cattle and the production of milk, because he sells dairy products.

Enrique wants a larger loan, and in the future he wants to increase his cattle and the production of milk, in order to expand the sale of dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase a pregnant cow.

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie is a hard-working entrepreneur with three children. She runs a soft drink business in the Philippines and has requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of soft drinks to resell.

Arlie industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her internet cafe. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old, married to Prisca and supports a family of seven. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).
Joseph has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya. With this, he plans to buy a cow for milk production so he can meet the demands of his customers for milk. 
He hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes to make more Andean skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a curio shop to sell the carved curios, which he hopes will enable him to get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a storage area for the bricks

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 63 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nancy has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tools and oils for sale in his motorcycle repair shop, and to use other tools and implements for maintaining his motorcycle for better transportation services.

loans.name: Tweimukye Buhungiro Group

texts.en: Edson, a member of Tweimukye Buhungiro Group, lives in Kagadi, Uganda. His business is selling local brew, a business he started in 2009. He started the business to look after his family's increasing needs. His dream is to become a leading supplier of local brew in his area. He meets difficulties of price fluctuations affecting his returns and lack of enough capital to buy enough stock. Edson intends to use the loan to buy local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ronald Xavier

texts.es:
El señor  Ronald de 31 años de edad  vive con su familia en su casa de habitación, se dedica al negocio que es la venta de  marisco desde hace 10 años, También tiene ingreso como empleado de inversiones S.A  la mayoría de sus clientes le visitan en su casa de habitación donde vende su producto.
Ronald está solicitando el crédito para mejorar  de su lancha quiere reparar el motor y algunos detalles para tenerla en perfecto estado, su negocio está ubicado en la comunidad de Coyolito al sur de Honduras.
 Esta solicitando 25, 000.00 lempiras para reparación de la lancha. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Don Ronald desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Ronald su sueño es  mejorar más sus ingresos en su negocio y darle una mejor vida a su familia. En la fotografía aparece con su hijo quien le gustan las cámaras y también le gusta que le tomen fotografías.
San Lorenzo, Valle - Abril del 2015
texts.en:
Ronald is 31 years old and lives with his family. For ten years, he has made a living at his business selling seafood. He also earns money as an employee at a private business. The majority of Ronald’s customers come to his home to buy seafood.

Ronald is applying for a loan in order to make improvements to his boat. He wants to repair the motor and some other aspects so that it is in perfect condition. Ronald’s business is in Coyolito, in the south of Honduras.

Ronald is applying for a loan of 25,000 Lempira to repair his boat. Ronald hopes that his profits and this loan will allow him to move forward and continue increasing his income.

Ronald’s dream is to increase income from his business and to give his family a better life. In the photo is Ronald’s son, who likes cameras and likes to have his photo taken.

San Lorenzao Valle, April 2015.

loans.use: to repair the motor and other aspects of his boat for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Ellene

texts.en:
Ellene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ellene dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mercedes Alicia

texts.es: Mercedes desde muy joven inclinó su gusto por el diseño y la confección de ropa, ella aprendió este arte de la mano de su madre quien era confeccionista de ropa y fue su tutora. Hoy en día este negocio constituye para ella una fuente representativa de ingresos y cuenta con 20 años de experiencia y trayectoria en este campo. Mercedes ha logrado mantenerse gracias al reconocimiento de su excelente servicio y diseños a la vanguardia, atributos que han consolidado  una clientela fidelizada. Los productos que ella elabora son uniformes escolares y empresariales, vestidos, blusas, camisa y demás prendas de vestir.
