He hopes that this will allow him to offer his customers a good service and meet their various needs. This will enable him to increase his earnings and improve he and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle, which is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income in addition to her husband's income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. 

She has a business producing school uniforms, repairing clothes and making and selling durable sacks in the local community. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional materials, textiles and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and to supply durable sacks in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, textiles and sewing supplies.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Angel Custodio

texts.es:
La venta de frutas, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Angel, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja solo todos los días durante 8 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de frutas y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Ángel is an energetic, tenacious man who started a business selling fruit three years ago to support his family. Fruit sales seemed like a promising business to Ángel, who lacks the education that many other professions require. He starts his workday early in the morning and spends eight hours a day, every day, running the business.   

Ángel is a kindhearted man who is attentive to the concerns and desires of his customers. He's applying for a loan from the Corporación Interactuar for the purchase of additional fruits that will increase his inventory and allow him to boost his sales. 

Ángel hopes one day to set up his own fruit shop in a quiet and comfortable location. Help Ángel meet his goals and support him today!

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to increase his sales.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es una mujer emprendedora, tenaz y trabajadora, desde hace un tiempo comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

Ella vive en el municipio de Sincelejo con su esposo y un hijo por el cual vela para que su vida se cada día mejor.

Ella trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como limón, zanahoria, tomate, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Señora Consuelo is an enterprising, tenacious and hardworking woman. Some time ago, she set up a grocery store which has given her good results so far.

Consuelo lives in the town of Sincelejo with her husband and son, who she cares for to make his life better each and every day. She works every day for eight hours, serving a medium to high number of customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy bulk products such as lemons, carrots, and tomatoes, in order to meet customers' needs. This will help her to inject variety into her business, and provide her with the juicy opportunity to boost her sales and household income.

loans.use: to buy bulk products such as lemons, carrots, and tomatoes, in order to meet customers' needs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and a farmer. They have three children, who are all school-age. 

Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (small grocery) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits of the co-op. She became a member in June of 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart some day. She will be fully satisfied if she can renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has chosen to live as single in Aloran, Philippines. 

She joined PMPC after she learned about the financial assistance it gives for business start-ups.  

Mercedes owns and manages a small restaurant, which is located on a national road highway that many people pass looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their town, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 47 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Жылдыз высшее образование, работает врачом уже 24 года. Ее ежемесячная заработная плата- 26,800 сом (KGS). Она решила сделать дома ремонт и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дверей и строительных материалов для замены крыши дома. Свои доходы Жылдыз планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 47, married, and has three children. She has a university education and has been a doctor for 24 years. She earns a monthly salary of 26,800 som (KGS). She decided to renovate her home and applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy doors and building materials to repair her roof. She plans to use her income to invest in future improvements to her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy doors and construction materials to repair her roof

loans.name: Victor Zenon

texts.es:
Victor, un hombre de 57 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Trabaja solo todos los días durante 12 horas.

Buscando ser tener la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.
De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Victor con su negocio!
texts.en:
Victor is a 57-year-old man who has done whatever was necessary to overcome the challenges he has faced and provide for his family. Victor's great patience and sacrifice of allowed him to establish a successful grocery store that generates income for the support of his children. Victor works 12 hours a day every day in the store. 

Victor is always looking for ways to improve his business and wants to apply for loan to purchase grains and basic grocery items to boost his inventory. This investment will allow Victor to meet challenges such as low sales and competition.

This loan represents a great opportunity for Victor to establish his store as the best in the neighborhood and fulfill his dream of buying his own home.

Help Victor by supporting his business!

loans.use: to purchase grains and basic grocery items to boost his inventory.

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is from Aloran, Philippines. He is a farmer who owns coco land and raises live stock like cows, carabao, chicken, and pigs. He also cultivates rice land for sale and consumption. This is how he raised his family for more than three decades. 

To generate additional earnings, he wants to plant bananas, grow root crops and start to finance his gardening project. Isabelo makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. He recently needed a loan, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC, to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings. 

Isabelo wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings.

loans.name: Aishabubu

texts.ru: Айшабубу, 55 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Айшабубу, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 лошади, 2 жеребенка, 5 коров, 50 овец, 15 коз, на участке мерою 8,0 Га она выращивает люцерну и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айшабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 лошадей. Доходы от кредита Айшабубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aishabubu is 55, married, and has six children. She has a secondary education and has been raising livestock and planting crops to support her family since 1995. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four horses, two foals, five cows, fifty sheep, fifteen goats, and an 8.0 hectare plot of land where she grows alfalfa and barley. In order to expand her business, Aishabubu applied for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy three horses. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three horses in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
A sus 50 años, Domingo tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de venta de legumbres y frutas en el municipio de San Bernardo Del Viento.

Vive en una humilde casa con su compañera sentimental y con sus 4 hijos a quienes enseña el valor del trabajo duro y el valor del cuidado a la familia.

Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la escases en productos y el clima.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo comprando mayor cantidad de producto en las épocas de cosecha y es precisamente ese el motivo por el cual solita un préstamo, pues desea comprar gran cantidad de frutas como sandia, mango, banano, entre otros, y de esta forma consolidara su negocio para el futuro.
texts.en:
At 50, Domingo has a lot of energy and drive to work in his business selling fruit and vegetables in the town of San Bernardo Del Viento. He lives in a humble home with his partner and his 4 children, who he teaches the value of hard work and caring for family.

He is currently facing business problems due to a lack of produce and bad weather. He is attempting to compensate for this by buying a greater quantity of produce during harvest season, which is why he is requesting a loan. He wants to buy large quantities of fruit such as watermelons, mangos, and bananas in order to consolidate his business for the future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of fruit such as watermelons, mangos, and bananas in order to consolidate his business for the future.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 63 years old and is married. She is from Sindangan, Philippines. She and her husband work together raising their family. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family needs especially the education of her children.

Belen was playing with the idea to start a bakery business since she and her husband have the baking skills. In 2010, Belen had her first loan from PMPC. Belen joined PMPC, after hearing that she could avail financial assistance, so she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital for her bakery business and it's done well over the years.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers. 

Today, Belen has acquired three motorcycles, which will deliver her bread all over the area and neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y residen en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Juan siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con la siembra de maíz, frijoles y últimamente café. la producción la vende en la zona o mercados locales. Actualmente esta solicitando un segundo préstamo en la institución por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos, fertilizantes y limpieza de sus cultivos, con el fin de tecnificar su finca de café y sacar mejor producción. Su meta es ampliar la finca, comprar un terreno mas y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Juan is 47 years old and lives with his partner, with whom he has three children, in a small village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Juan has always made a living in agriculture, growing corn, beans, and recently, coffee. He sells his produce in the area or at local markets. He is currently requesting a second loan of 20,000 lempiras from the institution to buy inputs and fertilisers and to clean his crops. He wants to modernise his coffee farm and improve output. His goals are to expand his farm, buy more land and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilisers and to clean his crops.

loans.name: Javier Eduardo

texts.es:
Javier es de la ciudad de Momil se dedica a ser independiente hace 20 años, es soltero, y con la ayuda de su madre se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocido en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de comidas en una salsamentaría, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido como carne, pollo, verduras, granos, entre otros, que le permitan aumentar su cantidad de insumos para la preparación de alimentos de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Javier is an industrious, tenacious single man from the city of Momil with great ambitions for success. He has worked diligently for the past 20 years so that he can be independent. Javier opened a small restaurant with the help of his mother and has turned the business into a popular local eatery.  The restaurant generates the income that Javier needs to support his family. 

Javier is applying for a loan to purchase items such as red meat, chicken, vegetables, grains, and other supplies that will allow him to boost his inventory for the preparation of food. This investment will allow Javier to boost his income and grow his business to the greatest extent possible.

loans.use: to purchase items such as red meat, chicken, vegetables, grains, and other supplies that will allow him to boost his inventory for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Jessielyn

texts.en:
Jessielyn is 40 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 school-age children. 

Jessielyn is engaged in a sari sari store and a RTW (ready to wear clothing) business. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She is also earning support from her husband who is a cargo truck driver. Jessielyn earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month from her business activities. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods to sell. Jessielyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. 

In the future, Jessielyn hopes to expand her sari sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 53 years old, is married with two children and is a resident of Solinog, Calamba, Philippines. 

Lydia has had a transport business for more than 10 years. Now, she attempts to venture into vegetable vending as another source of livelihood. 

Lydia decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. 

In the future, Lydia hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six children who are now of adult age. 

Alicia earns her living from dried-fish vending and a little from her parcel of coco-land. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Alicia has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stock of dried fish for retail. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her dried-fish vending business to nearby barangays in her region.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, age 62, is from Pagadian. She is married with 4 children. 

Perla joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store. Helping the family survive, she never gets tired of tending her little store. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and she makes promising daily sales. Perla keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with the support of her family, they will sustain and beat the competition. 

Perla is now trying to expand her resources and has decided to establish a chicken and pork barbecue vending business for added income. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC for financing of the project. She has applied for a loan to purchase chicken and pork meat so that she can continue to put bread and butter on the family's table. 

With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and pork meat for her business.

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josie Lyn

texts.en:
Josie Lyn is 37 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two school-aged children. Josie Lyn earns a salaried living as a consumers coop attendant in one of the coop’s in the area. She’s been in that service for two years already and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month. This amount is very helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for comfort room repair.

Josie Lyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Josie Lyn hopes to engage in retail business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 52, is married with three adult-aged children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children.

 Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren; she has now started a food vending business. 

Rebecca already accessed loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store and also to pay for additional raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has six chidren. To earn a living, Leonila manages her rice farm and raises livestock. Since she has been doing this for two decades, she is a master at her job. 

Leonila joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to access insurance and credit. She is hardworking and determined to pursue her goals in order to cover her needs. 

Leonila is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm. She also plans to purchase additional piglets, animal feed, and vitamins. This will greatly help her boost her income. Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her rice farming activities and venture into the rice-retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, additional piglets, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia, 54, is married with three adult children. She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been engaged in the snack vending business for four years. She earns at least 2,000 Philippine pesos each month in this type of work.
 
Artemia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase varieties of snacks for reselling.  

In the future, she hopes to establish her own snack house.

loans.use: To buy varieties of snacks to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

Fe was able to turn the tide in her favour and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, Fe took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, Fe hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Aitolkun

texts.ru: Айтолкун, 59 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Айтолкун в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров и 15 овец. Также есть 2,10 ГА земельной доли, где она выращивает фасоль. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтолкун обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 15 овец и удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Айтолкун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, в будущем планирует накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en: Aitolkun is 59, married, and the mother of five children. She has a vocational education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she began 19 years ago. Thanks to Aitolkun’s hard work, she currently has five cows and 15 sheep, along with a 2.10 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. All in all her monthly income averages around 17,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Aitolkun applied for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount through the purchase of 15 sheep and to buy fertilizers for her crops. Aitolkun plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock and in the future she will save money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and 15 sheep

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 43 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now adult or school aged. Razel earns a living from snack vending, particularly selling “suman” (a variety of rice cake) in their barangay (neighborhood). She’s been in the business for five years already and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month. This amount is very helpful to meet their needs. 

Razel has requested a loan to be used in purchasing malagkit rice, sugar, and other ingredients for her suman making and vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Razel hopes that her suman will become famous not only in her area but also in other towns and even abroad.

loans.use: to purchase malagkit (sticky) rice, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en: Viviana, a hardworking mother, is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more assorted goods for her store. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods for her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, 62, has five adult children. She lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been engaged in the hog raising business for 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos each month from this business. 

Paulina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase two piglets and sacks of feed for her hog raising business. 

In the future, Paulina hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Zuralla Angela

texts.en:
Zuralla Angela, 28, is married with one school-aged child. She lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Zuralla Angela has been engaged in the hog fattening and hog raising business for almost two years and receives monthly support from her husband, who is a seaman. She earns approximately 5,000 Phillipine pesos each month doing this type of business. 

Zuralla Angela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost a year. She has requested a loan to purchase five sacks of booster feeds for her hog fattening and hog raising business.

In the future, Zuralla Angela hopes to expand her business by purchasing more piglets.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of booster feeds

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, tiene 29 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en el Municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Denis inicio trabajando en jornal en la elaboración de ladrillos de construcción y hace año y medio inició su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Esta actividad la tiene en su casa además ofrece el servicio de moler maíz a particulares. Esta solicitado el segundo préstamo en la institución por 27,000 Lempiras para comprar maíz, leña y cal para cocinar el maíz que utiliza en la elaboración de tortillas y pago de mano de obra, ya que cuenta con 5 empleados. Además del préstamo va tomar una parte para terminar de cancelar el molino que utiliza para moler el maíz. Con esta inversión va cubrir la demanda actual. El tiene planes de ampliar el negocio, contratar mas personal y mejorar la calidad del producto para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Denis is 29 years old. He is single and lives in the Quimistán municipality in Santa Bárbara. Denis started working as a day laborer, making bricks for construction. A year and a half ago, he started his own business making and selling corn tortillas. He does this in his house. He also offers corn milling services to individuals. 

He is requesting his second loan with the institution, of 27,000 Lempiras, to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder to cook the corn that he uses to make tortillas. He will also use it to pay for labor, since he now has 5 employees. He will also use part of the loan to pay off the mill that he uses to grind the corn. With this investment, he can cover his current demand. He has plans to expand his business, hire more people, and improve the quality of his product to obtain higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood; to pay for labor; and also to pay off his corn-grinding mill.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 school aged child.
 
For the past five years, Merlyn has been engaged in a dried fish vending and a hog fattening business. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing these two businesses.  She has requested a loan to purchase 5,000 PHP worth of dried fish while the remaining funds will buy 5 sacks of booster and grower feed for her pigs.  Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. 

In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her dried fish vending and hog raising businesses.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has considerable preparing to do for the post-harvest operations of her palay (unhulled rice) in Bonifacio. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another crop season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took out a loan.  

Lilibeth hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Cecelle

texts.en:
Cecelle landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after she went broke when her first business went bad. PMPC came to Cecelle as a rescue to lend her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, Cecelle availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Cecelle perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 44, is married with two adult children. She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Elsie has been engaged in managing her own sari-sari store business for 20 years. She earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos each month in this type of business. Her earnings are very helpful in meeting the family's needs.  

Elsie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven years. She has requested a loan to redeem her pawned parcel of cocoa land. 

In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her sari-sari business.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned parcel of cocoa land

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie, 53, is married with no dependents. She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 
 
Nellie earns a living from a snack vending business. She has been engaged in this business for eight years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos each month from this business activity. 

Nellie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight years. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs.  

In the future, Nellie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and was gifted with five children. Sarah and her husband are both farmers. They raised their family doing this type of activity. This industrious member finds herself with her husband ploughing the rice field, planting vegetables and other agricultural commodities to continue putting bread on their table. 

In need of additional working capital, Sarah decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already.  Recently, she requested a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for labor cost, land preparation on her rice farm and fertilizers and herbicides to increase her crop yield.

Being a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) of the Cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Sarah is very thankful because if it were not for PMPC, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. 

She hopes to own a land tractor someday for fast and easy farm work.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, land preparation, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, and earning income as well. Dolores has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

As a farmer, Dolores has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, Dolores applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs, bags of fertilizer, herbicides and rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, Dolores hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, bags of fertilizer, herbicides and rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor makes good earnings from her rice farm in Molave. This is her primary source of income and it supports her needs. 

Miraflor approached PMPC to request a loan to pay for the post harvesting of her palay (unhusked rice). She wants to ensure that she will have enough time and resources for this cropping. 

She has high hopes that she will have a good yield next cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for post harvesting of her palay (unhusked rice).

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
As a farmer, Roseminda makes a good living with her coconut farm in Sindangan, in the Philippines. She also runs a small grocery store business for additional earning and suffice their daily needs. Roseminda has been able to send all her children to school. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts and banana of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. 

However, Roseminda is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings and the buying of dwarf coconut seedlings. Roseminda has high hopes that she will have more farm yield in the future.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clear and plow her land, plant seedlings and buying of dwarf coconut seedlings

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is married and is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables, and beans.

Norberto wants to increase sales from his corn and vegetable farm. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put food on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Percillano

texts.en:
Pecillano is 51 years old and married; he lives in Molave. For a living, Pecillano is managing his rice farm. He also has a piggery business. Pecillano mastered doing these types of activities over two decades now. He joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in May of 2012. He is determined to pursue his goals to sustain his needs, alleviating poverty. 

Pecillano requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase production on his rice farm, as well as additional piglets, animal feed and vitamins. This will greatly help Pecillano earn more money. Someday, he hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand his rice farming and be able to venture into the rice retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to increase production on his rice farm, and buy additional piglets, animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children, who are now adults.
 
Delia owns a parcel of coconut land that stands as one of her sources of income to meet her needs. Her husband is presently employed as a barangay secretary. The couple is also receiving support from their daughter abroad.  They earn approximately PHP18,000.00 each month doing these activities.  

She has requested a loan to be used as additional finances to purchase a 2nd hand Starex van for personal use. 
Delia is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Delia hopes to engage in a buy and sell business.

loans.use: To use as additional finances to buy a 2nd hand Starex van

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Molave and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, Elizabeth applied for a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Elizabeth knows that she has to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to buy a rice thresher and farm tractor for additional earnings for their family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as  fertilizer and to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Projectthunder.com, Inc. Group

texts.en:
ProjectThunder.com, Inc. was cofounded by Calvin and Aleksey (Alex) a little over 10 years ago. Since then, the company has been helping companies, small and large, make an impact on their businesses and even change their very definition of success. ProjectThunder.com helps businesses make their mark on the internet and be competitive in our ever-increasing technology-centered world. 

Calvin grew up in one of the poorest communities of California where survival was an everyday obstacle and simply seizing an opportunity to better one’s life itself was a challenge. His tenacity, willingness to learn, and dedication to always producing his best work allowed him to gain the experience he now uses to thrive as an entrepreneur. “ProjectThunder literally saved my life…” confessed Calvin, and he wants to provide employment opportunities for bright individuals by expanding the company. 

Alex loves his role at ProjectThunder because he has the opportunity to address his clients’ needs and still allow creative breathing room to find a solution. He is always learning to build on his craft, implementing the latest innovations and increasing his research and development for the benefit of the company. They hope one day to become an international company and bring employment opportunities to the less fortunate in Third World countries. 

With this loan, Calvin and Alex will be able to purchase essential software and specialized field equipment, increase their advertising and marketing, and hire additional software developers to increase the positive impact of ProjectThunder.

loans.use: to help pay for software and to hire new employees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and has three children, all of whom go to school.  She is married.

Grace is in the aquacultural business, farming oysters in the Philippines. Grace requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and binders for her oysters.

Grace has been oyster farming for 15 years and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Grace would like to save money in hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and binders for her oyster farming business.

loans.name: Manglares Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Fátima, Luisa Ángel y Maura) pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios de venta de bastimento.

Fátima: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven alegre con cualidades de líder. Casada con un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de bastimentos, leña y carbón. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar tubérculos, plátanos, filipitas, coco, carbón y  leñas. Sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three strong women (Fátima, Luisa Ángel, and Maura). They are part of the Miskito ethnic group. They live in Bilwi, which is in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They recently formed the group with the goal of securing financing to improve their living conditions, cover their basic household needs, ensure their children’s education, and expand their food sales businesses.

Fátima is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a happy young woman with leadership qualities. She is married and has a small child who is 2 years old. Her husband works in the informal sector as a carpenter. In order to contribute to the household expenses and have her own source of income, for the past 5 years she has worked by selling food, firewood, and charcoal. She is requesting her first loan to buy tubers, plantains, bananas, coconut, charcoal, and firewood. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy tubers, plantains, bananas, coconut, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora comes from the highland barangay of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age and the sole bread winner to her one child, who is now of school age. Teodora earns a living from her coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading business. She's been in the business for 11 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a widow. 

Teodora has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional coconuts and copra for resale. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to have a coconut and copra trading buying station.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and copra for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 46, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with three kids, and her husband is a construction worker as a mason/carpenter. The store is her means of earning a living to help support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Josephine keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain themselves and beat the competition.  
	
Josephine has reached her fourth year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional inventory for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for the store

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie is from Bonifacio. She and her husband have riceland and earn a living doing farming activities. 

Recently, Lynie availed a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland, and she hopes to yield more harvest in the next cropping season. 

Lynie deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey makes good earnings from his farming activities in Tambulig. This is how he supports his family and is able to send his children to school. 

He wants to increase his farm yield, so Rey approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, bags of fertilizer and litres of herbicides. He has high hopes that he will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, bags of fertilizer and litres of herbicides

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 65 years old and married with two children. Melinda works very hard to provide for them.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 57 years old and is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Luisa has a candy-making business in the Philippines. Luisa has requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

Luisa has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business

loans.name: Len Mie

texts.en:
Len Mie works hard to support herself. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Len Mie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Len Mie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 48 years old, married, and has six children. One of her children is in school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesryl

texts.en:
Jesryl is 32 years old, married, and has two children. 

Jesryl is in the aquaculture business, farming oystersin the Philippines. Jesryl requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binders, fishing net and other equipment.

Jesryl has been farming oysters for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jesryl would like to save money to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders, fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Herminia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 47 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Nemia works very hard to provide for them.

Nemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nemia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Nemia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Koem Tarn

texts.en:
Koem Tarn lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, constante, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en ‘Puerto Pérez’ a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca; uno de los lugares más hermosos y misteriosos de América, cuenta con una iglesia, Unidad Educativa; y muy pronto agua potable. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entren 0-12 grados centígrados.
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que son agricultores, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la pesca, las variedades más comunes del lugar son; mauri, ispi, carachi, pejerrey y trucha. “la pesca en el lago se da por temporadas, ya está por terminar la temporada de pesca y nos dedicamos a la agricultura…” comenta. La venta de su negocio es que lleva varios años de experiencia y conoce bien el rubro, la desventaja son las temporadas del año. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo para que las temporadas de invierno sean más agradables, ella desea realizar la compra de un ganado lechero para continuar con su actividad de agricultura en la época que no se puede pescar. El motivo de su solicitud es debido a la finalización de temporada de pesca para continuar con su actividad de agricultura para volver el año siguiente a su negocio pesquero. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de un ganado lechero para continuar con su actividad de agricultura y construir su casa de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Adela is a 34-year-old woman, single, and childless. She is a fisherwoman.
She is an entrepreneur, patient, constant, independent, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs her business in ‘Puerto Pérez’ on the shore of the sacred Lake Titicaca. This is one of the most beautiful and mysterious parts of America. The community has a church and an education centre. Soon, it will have running water. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees celsius. 
Adela is dark-skinned, with brown eyes and long black hair which she wears in a braid. She is short and of average build and dresses traditionally (hat, traditional skirt, and sweater). Her mother tongue is Aymará. She speaks this language with her family and speaks Spanish for her business and due to the general culture. She shares her life with her family members who are farmers. They live in their own adobe home with a corrugated iron roof. Their home has electricity and well-water that they extract with an electric pump. 
Adela's business is fishing. The most common types of fish in the area are: mauri, ispi, carachi, pejerrey and trout. "Fishing in the lake is seasonal. The fishing season is about to end, so we work in farming", she says. The advantage of her business is that she has several years' experience and knows the work well. The challenge is the seasons. Her dream is to build a brick home so that the winter will be more pleasant. She wants to buy a dairy cow to continue with her farming activities in the season when she cannot fish. Her goal for this loan is to continue farming in the season when she cannot fish so that she can return to fishing the next year. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the fifteen years she has been doing this work.
For these reasons, Adela is requesting a loan for the purchase of a dairy cow to continue with her farming and build a brick home.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to continue with her farm business and build her home.

loans.name: Ram

texts.en:
Ram and his wife (both in the picture, standing in-front of their house) work day and night to support their family. Ram gets up in the early morning everyday to do farming, while his wife works in a factory. They always have a concern about their 5 years old son, as the family is using a car battery for a power source that contains acid. Their only son is small. They are afraid the kid could meet with an accident because of carelessness. 

Seeing their concern, their neighbor recommended them to switch to a solar power home system because it is safe and sustainable. After hearing a reasonable explanation in the neighborhood, Ram and his wife decided to apply to Kiva in order to buy a solar home system. Using a solar home system, they would be relieved, because they have no worries about their child's safety. The family also can live in good conditions with a bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power home system.

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Marithel

texts.en:
Marithel is 31 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Marithel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marithel has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marithel would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia is 59 years old, married and has four children.

Cerenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cerenia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cerenia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cerenia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Rosalie has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a widow with five children. She is 33 years old and has three children already in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Perla has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Perla has been in this business for three years. In the future, Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es: Floridalma, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo, y reside en una aldea que pertenece a San Luis, Santa Bárbara. Hace 4 años se dedica al cultivo de café y siembra de vivero de café para vender. Esta producción de café la vende en bodegas de la zona. Con el fin de poder ofrecer café a mas bodegas ha decidido invertir 15,000 para comprar abonos y fertilizar su finca de café para sacar una producción de calidad. Tiene como meta utilizar las ganancias para comprar una manzana mas de terreno para cultivar mas café.
texts.en:
Floridalma is 34 and a single mother with one child to care for. She lives in a hamlet belonging to San Luis, Santa Bárbara. She has cultivated coffee and sold coffee plants for four years. She sells her coffee to cafes in the area. With the goal of being able to offer coffee to more cafes, she has decided to invest 15,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer for her farm so that she can obtain a quality harvest.
Her goal is to use her earnings to purchase another block of land to cultivate more coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Kimlin

texts.en:
Kimlin and his wife, businesspeople and also fisherfolk, live in Koh Tamov village with three children. Kimlin has to get up early in the morning to do fishing while his wife needs to stand by in the shop the whole day. They need energy to light up their house in early morning; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without their noticing. They have no choice but to stop business early and stay in pitch black for until morning; this disturbs not only their lifestyle but also their business. 

Therefore, Kimlin is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to cover his business’s energy usage and also his family's usage. With a solar home system, he won't have to be concerned about sudden power outages anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de 29 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 4 y 6 años de edad, él se siente muy feliz porque su vivienda es propia. Francisco a base de mucho esfuerzo logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, apoyado en su venta de frutas que realiza en el mercado municipal, usando su creatividad se desplaza a los mercados vecinos donde busca nuevos clientes. Observando que cada día sus ventas son mejores, ha decidido, comprar un vehículo, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertirlo en la compra de un vehículo para transportar toda su mercadería y cubrir la demanda y las exigencias de sus clientes ya que por su amabilidad hacia ellos y calidad de frutas es muy buscado por ellos y buscando también con esta inversión mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas y esposa. Francisco solicito un crédito anteriormente el cual invirtió en la compra de lámina para cambiar el techo, lo que le permite vivir más tranquilo sabiendo que su vivienda y su familia están más seguras.
texts.en:
Francisco is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters aged 4 and 6. He feels very happy because his house is his. Francisco through great effort manages to provide the sustenance for his household, aided by his fruit sales he does at the municipal market and using his creativity to go to neighboring markets where he finds new clients.

Observing that his sales are greater each day, he has decided to buy a vehicle. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in a vehicle to transport all his merchandise and cover the demand and requirements of his clients. They look for him a lot due to his friendliness towards them and the quality of his fruit. He is looking with this inversion to improve the quality of living for his wife and children.

Francisco requested a previous loan which he invested in buying laminate sheeting to replace his roof which allowed him to live more peacefully in his house with his family more secure.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 51-year-old married woman with two grown children from Mcarthur, Leyte. She has been raising hogs for five years already. Her husband earns a living by farming. She has no capital to sustain her existing business, so she decided to take a loan.

She is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed. This will help improve the way she raises hogs. She will be able to sell healthy hogs in the coming months. With these sales, her income will improve, and she will start to gain control of her finances. She could set aside some savings for emergency use and to expand her business.

Emma is hoping that she can handle her hog raising business for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  pig feed

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is 58 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To help her husband for a living, she is engaged in a fish vending business. Her husband also does the fishing. To increase their income, she decided to borrowed a loan again to buy new fishing nets and have more fish to sell in the market.

Violita wants in the future to expand her business and to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 62 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Silveria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and personal care products. 

In the future Silveria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hannah Melodee

texts.en:
Hannah Melodee is 48 years old, married with five children.

Hannah Melodee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hannah Melodee has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Hannah Melodee aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 23 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilou has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 53 years old, married with one child.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Julieta has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married.

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maharlika

texts.en:
Maharlika is 28 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Maharlika has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Maharlika requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maharlika has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maharlika would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov and his wife (both in the picture, standing in front of their house) own a trading business in Prey Gneam Village and 10 hectares of land. Trading charcoal and cattle from KomPong Chnang to Phnom Penh, they run their business very well. However, getting up early to prepare products on the car to bring to Phnom Penh is their daily workload. Pov and his wife need a lot of energy to generate light day and night, but his current energy solution (a car battery) is not reliable. Some of the time, a car battery works well. Sometimes, after just one day or a half day it runs out, which delays their work a lot. 

As a result, Pov and his wife decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. They believe solar home energy can enhance their business conditions and also their lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Prey Gneam Village, Svay Chork Commue, Samaki Mean

loans.name: Trabajadores De Brisas Group

texts.es: Marvin, tiene 25 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a sus padres en una aldea que pertenece a Cofradía, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, frijol, café y hortalizas, desde pequeño ayudaba a sus padres. Actualmente cuenta con sus propias parcelas donde obtiene sus propios ingresos. Este cultivo lo realiza en una zona apta para el cultivo de café y hortalizas.Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su finca y cultivos, de esta forma obtendrá mejor cosecha. Su plan es seguir trabajando para poder construir su casa y lograr tener sus propias tierras para trabajar. Este préstamo es por 24,000 Lempiras en forma grupal. El grupo se llama Trabajadores de Brisas, integrado por 3 miembros agricultores y viven en la misma zona.  El monto de préstamo es por 24,000 Lempiras para compra de abonos y fertilizantes para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Marvin, Juvenal y Mario a la derecha.
texts.en:
Marvin is 25, single, and lives with his parents in a hamlet belonging to Cofradía, Cortes. He has always cultivated corn, beans, coffee, and vegetables; he helped his parents from a young age. He now has his own plots of land from which he obtains his own income. It is in a good spot for cultivating coffee and vegetables. He has decided to request a loan of 10,000 lempiras for the purchase of manure and fertilizer to maintain his farm and crops. This way, he will obtain a better harvest. His plan is to keep working to be able to build his home and obtain his own land to work on. This is a loan for 24,000 for the group. The group is called Trabajadores de Brisas, and is made up of three farmers who live in the same zone. 
Pictured from left to right: Marvin, Juvenal and Mario.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Lucia 2 Group

texts.es: María, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside junto a su esposo e hijos en el municipio de Intibucá. Toda su vida a trabajado en la agricultura con el cultivo de papas, esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. La zona donde produce es apta para este cultivo y la producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar 8 quintales de abono, insecticidas, fungicidas, cal y gallinaza para preparación de la tierra y realizar sus cultivos. Tiene como plan seguir cultivando mas papas y con las ganancias darle mejor educación a sus hijos. El grupo se llama Santa Lucia 2, formado por 3 personas que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal es por 45,000 lempiras, para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para cultivo de papas. En la foto esta María a la Izquierda, Adelina y Justina a la derecha.
texts.en:
María, age 31, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the municipality of Intibucá. She has worked all her life in agriculture, cultivating potatoes. This business is the source of income for her family. The zone where she farms is very good for this work. She sells her produce in the local market. Her part of the group loan is 15,000 lempiras. With it, she will buy 8 quintals of manure, insecticides, fungicides, limestone and hen droppings to prepare the land for her crops.
Her plan is to cultivate more potatoes and to use her earnings to give her children a better education.
This group is called Santa Lucia 2. It is made up of 3 people who work in agriculture and live in the same zone. 
The group loan is for a total of 45,000 lempiras. It is for the purchase of fertilizers and supplies for the cultivation of potatoes. 
They are pictured left to right: María, Adelina, and Justina.

loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of manure, insecticides, fungicides, limestone and hen droppings.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 37 years old and has four children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Beatriz is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Beatriz has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Beatriz would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en:
Rodina works hard to support her family. Rodina is married and has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Rodina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell like T-shirts, shorts, slippers and other ready-to-wear products.

Rodina has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell like T-shirts, shorts, slippers and other ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Ma. Melodina

texts.en:
Ma. Melodina works hard to support her family. Ma. Melodina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Melodina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food-production business.

Ma. Melodina has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food-production business

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Reina se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, cultiva maíz, frijol y también café. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos en su familia. Con el fin de seguir produciendo, ha solicitado otro préstamo siendo este el tercer ciclo en la institución y es por 8,000 lempiras para insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para darle buen mantenimiento a su finca de café. Tiene como plan utilizar las ganancias en la compra de caballos para trasladarse a su finca y sacar las cosechas.
texts.en:
Reina is 43 years old and is in a common-law relationship with her partner with whom she has two children in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Reina has worked in agriculture for 15 years growing corn, beans and also coffee. This business is the source of income for the family.

With the aim of continuing her production she has requested another loan this being her third with the institution of 8,000 HNL. She will purchase inputs, manure and fertilizer to provide good maintenance for her coffee plantation. Her plan is to utilize the profits to buy horses to move to her farm and transport the harvests.

loans.use: to buy inputs, manure and fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (Janet, Jhondra y Melisa), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace aproximadamente 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. 
 
Jhondra: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, casada con 6 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la comercialización de madera. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar combustible y poder transporta la madera de las comunidades a la ciudad de Bilwi y municipios de la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte (RACCN). Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three enterprising women (Janet, Jhondra and Melisa). They are Miskita and live in Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas.
They got together about three years ago with the goal of obtaining a loan to improve their living conditions, to cover their basic household costs, to ensure their children's education, and to expand their businesses.
Jhondura is a kind woman, married with six children, three of whom are grown. Her other three children are in elementary school. Her husband works as a farmer. With the goal of contributing to the household costs and her children's education, she has sold wood for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase firewood and to transport it to communities in the city of Bilwi and municipalities of the Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte (RACCN). She dreams of being a successful merchant and establishing a corner store.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to transport the wood.

loans.name: Luis Evaristo

texts.es:
Luis Evaristo tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto con su conviviente en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Cliente se dedica a la venta de material de construcción, este material lo reparte en su moto carguera, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 1 año por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, madera, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ventas mensuales y mejorará sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Evaristo is 33 years old. He lives with his partner in the district of Cayaltí, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru,

Luis works selling construction material which he distributes on his motorcycle cart. He has been working in these sales for one year so he has experience and good personal and labor references in the district. He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of construction materials like bricks, cement and wood amongst others to increase the stock of his business. Doing this he hopes to meet the needs of his clients which will generate greater monthly sales, improve his income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, cement and wood amongst others to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. Aside from her general store, she also has a tricycle for transportation service.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will use for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her income from her store and tricycle service is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Regina hopes to sustain and grow her two businesses to give her family a better life. She aims to give her children the best education possible, to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is a married woman with five children. She is 27 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Romana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sea food to sell.

Romana has been in this business for two years. In the future, Romana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Florita
