texts.en: Florita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to increase her stock of household goods to sell. Florita has been in this business for three years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has applied for another loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Florita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 34 years old and single with two children. With one child still in school, Glenda works very hard to provide for the family.

Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Glenda has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melona is 36 years old, and three of her children are in school.

She has a buying and selling of frozen foods business in the Philippines. Melona requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Melona has been in this business for six years. In the future, Melona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 38 years old and has four children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Susana is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hazel is 28 years old and has two children still in school.

Hazel has a photo printing business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Hazel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Anyela Yestri

texts.es:
Anyela es una humilde trabajadora residente en el municipio de Sincelejo con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es madre de 2 hijos por los cuales siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas en un carrito de comidas. 

Le dedica 10 horas diarias a su negocio.
De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo esta la inseguridad en la zona donde trabaja.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materias primas como carne, pan, queso, salsa al por mayor para tener una muy buen producción, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Anyela is a modest and hardworking resident of the town of Sincelejo whose life is full of dreams, hopes, and the best wishes for her family.  She's the mother of two children; she always had the strength and responsibility to care for them so they could have a better life.

Currently she earns a living making and selling fast food from a little food cart.  She devotes 10 hours a day to her business.  One of the main challenges she faces is insecurity in the area where she works.

Anyela's requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, bread, cheese, and sauce wholesale so her production is good.  That way she'll be able to earn enough income to continue with her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, bread, cheese, and sauce wholesale so her production is good

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa is a 27-year-old single student who lives in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She teaches English at a private school and has been a teacher for more than three years. (The small kids shown in the picture are her students.) As a teacher, she can make a daily income of $7. Channa is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in banking and finance. She is in her second year. She is applying for a loan because she needs funds to pay the tuition for the second semester of her second year. This loan will enable her to go through the second year successfully. In the future, she is going to find a good job using her skills, and she also wants to run a language school.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the second semester of her second year of studies for her bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is 28 years old and married. With two children who are in school, Roxan works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, chips, etc.

Roxan has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, chips, etc

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina works hard to support her family. Florentina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc.

Florentina has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Florentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Timotea is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Timotea requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Timotea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.en: Jovana is 27 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Jovana runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Jovana has been in this business for three years. She sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Jovana would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gaylive

texts.en: Gaylive is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gaylive is 43 years old and has three children, who are still in school. Gaylive has a business in the Philippines selling personal products. Gaylive applied for a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell, including body lotion and perfume. Gaylive has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including body lotion and perfume.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to use in making dried fish. Lydia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to use in making dried fish.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and both of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur

Charlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea food to sell.

Charlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and married and she  works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sardines, noodles, egg, spices, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sardines, noodles, egg, spices, etc

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Janice is 34 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Janice has a buy and sell beans business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beans to sell.

Janice has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a merchant residing in the town of Javier, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various commodities like canned goods, noodles, sugar, seasonings,shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs and soft drinks.  She is married with two children, ages 12 and 15 years old respectively.

Dolores has requested a loan to buy additional stock for the store, like beverages, toiletries, various drinks and canned goods.  This stock will enable her to improve the contents of her store and attract more buyers to shop and purchase. She could now handle her finances and start to expand her sari-sari (variety) store.
 
She is very grateful for the loan. She can now manage her existing business properly and also continue to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is grateful he was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase various beauty and hair products grocery items needed in his salon. His income from his salon helped provide for his daily needs.

He would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy beauty and hair products such as hair dyes, shampoo, hot oil, conditioner and hair scissors needed for his salon. His salon is quite well-known in the area for his skills and good service, so he already has regular customers. Because of the positive response of his clients, his salon is being referred and patronized in the community. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him, for it will surely fund his and his family's everyday needs.

Mario dreams of having a bigger and attractive salon to serve more customers. He wants to be of help to his parents and prays for long life and good health. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies 

. *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products for his salon.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad  es madre soltera su vivienda es propia actualmente vive sola, ya que su único hijo ya es independiente el cual le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Ella se ha esforzado por salir adelante durante varios años  prestando sus servicios domésticos gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo logro adquirir una refrigeradora hace 2 años, con lo  logro establecer una pequeña venta de frutas congeladas como jocotes, sandia, nances, piña, bananos, etc. (fruta de temporada) ya que por su edad ya no podía salir a realizar otros trabajos pero ya que le ha ido muy bien en la venta de frutas ella ha decidido comprar más frutas para ofrecer mayor variedad, por esta razón ella ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en la compra de manzanas, fresas, melón, etc., para así poder variar su venta y mejorar aún más su venta y de la misma manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She is a single mother and lives alone in a house she owns. Her son is independent and helps her to cover the home expenses. María has worked hard to get ahead. She has been working for some years as a housekeeper. Thanks to her hard work, she was able to buy a refrigerator two years ago and start selling frozen seasonal fruits such as sour plums, watermelon, nance, pineapple, and bananas. This is the only work she can do, due to her age.

María is doing very well selling fruits, so she has decided to buy more in order to offer a wider variety. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy apples, strawberries, melon, etc. She will have a wider variety to offer and her living conditions will improve as a result.

loans.use: to buy apples, strawberries, melon and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 57 years old, married and has two children. 

Antonia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonia has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 23 years old and single.

Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Liezel has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rubie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Rubie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Rubie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

Veronica has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Juvy Catalina

texts.en:
Juvy Catalina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur, with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like E-loading business. 

Juvy Catalina dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia Almira

texts.es:
Alicia, actualmente vive con sus cinco hijos de 33, 30, 28, 26 y 23 años de edad, todos costean sus propios gastos, para tener una fuente de ingresos propia hace 15 años instalo una tienda en su vivienda, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo.
Invertirá en arroz, aceite, frijol, huevos, cereales, golosinas y otros productos que le sean de ayuda para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, será de utilidad para mantener el negocio con vida y tener una situación financiera más estable.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio incorporando un nuevo rubro.
texts.en:
Alicia lives with her five children, who are 33, 30, 28, 26, and 32 years old. They all cover their own expenses. Thinking of having a stable source of income, Alicia opened a store at home fifteen years ago. She works every day, without a fixed schedule.

Alicia will buy rice, vegetable oil, beans, eggs, cereals, candies and other products she needs to fulfill her customers’ demands. This will help her very much to keep her business afloat and reach financial stability.

She dreams of expanding her business by offering other services.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, vegetable oil, beans, eggs, cereals, and candies to sell.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 22 years old, a single freshman, who is from the Battambang Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management at a university in the city. His parents are rice farmers. 

Samnang has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, and propane gas for her tortilla business

loans.name: Hayri

texts.en:
Hayri is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is married and has children. She is capable, active and a generous person. She works as an accountant and earns only 600 TJS. 

Her husband is sick and needs treatment. Hayri alone feeds her family, but she has no money for the treatment of her husband. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her husband in a medical clinic. She hopes her husband will be healthy.

loans.use: to treat her husband in a medical clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bacon, flour, corn, beans, vegetable oil, and cheese.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products.

Edralyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products

loans.name: Juan Ovidio

texts.es:
Juan, está necesitando de un nuevo préstamo para hacer preparativos para la milpa y mejorar la ganadería, comprara concentrado para el ganado, fertilizantes y pagara mozos para realizar las labores agrícolas de la temporada.
Se siente complacido al utilizar créditos para mejorar su negocio, la cosecha obtenida de granos básicos ha sido mucho más abundante que en años anteriores.
texts.en:
Juan is in need of a new loan in order to make preparations for the maize fields and to improve livestock farming. He will buy fee concentrate for the cattle, fertilisers and will pay porters to carry out seasonal agricultural work.

He feels pleased to have used loans to improve his business, the harvest of basic grains which he achieved has been much more abundant that in previous years.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for the cattle, fertilisers and to pay porters to carry out seasonal agricultural work

loans.name: Yahong

texts.en:
Yahong is a single mother of one child, who is in school. She is divorced from her husband, who had another wife. In addition, she looks after her mother, who is 90 years old.
 
Yahong is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and vegetables. She supplements the vegetables with income from a small stall. Her main customers are neighbors and passersby. She resorted to farming two years ago, after separating from her husband, so that she could fend for her child and take him to school. She does all this single handedly. 

Yahong requested ￥10,000 from MicroCred . She will use part of the loan to buy more stock for the retail business and use some of the money to pay school fees. 

The main challenge is that vegetables can easily go bad in summer. Because there is no fridge, if she could not sell out all her supplies in one day, tomorrow they will be bad, which cause a lot of loss for her. Sometimes she or her child falls sick and on those days she is unable to work at her business. 

Despite all the challenges, Yahong is very hard working and determined to change her future and that of her child, by giving him a good education.

loans.use: to buy more stock and to pay school fees

loans.name: Emmanuela

texts.en:
Emmanuela, 57, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a school bus driver. They both work for their daily sustenance.

Emmanuela is into rice retailing. She buys sacks of rice from a wholesaler and sells them by the kilo. She sells them per order and on demand on special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Rice is common to the Filipinos. Be it breakfast, lunch, or dinner, a Filipino meal cannot be complete without it, even amidst huge gatherings, and regardless of a resplendent menu. Even when it comes to merienda (snacks), rice is the Philippines’ staple food.

To help her continue with her business, Emmanuela would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy more sacks of rice to sell at retail price. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. It will surely help meet their daily needs and save for their old age.

Emmanuela plans to buy a truck to deliver rice to households. She aims to sustain and grow her business to progress in life. She prays for good health and a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice to sell at retail price.

loans.name: Desiderio De Los Angeles

texts.es: Desiderio de 43 años de edad y su esposa viven en casa propia la cual con su arduo trabajo y el apoyo de su esposa ha logrado construir. El es un hombre muy trabajador el cual presta sus servicios de seguridad, trabajando 24 horas y descansa 12 horas para poder llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Desiderio aun no logra terminar de construir su casa, por lo que ha decidido construir un muro perimetral y así ver terminada su casa que es su más grande sueño, para ello esta solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y grava para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor seguridad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Desiderio is 43 years old and lives with his wife in his own house, which he managed to build with hard work and the help of his wife.

He is a very hard working man who provides security services, working for 24 hours and then resting for 12 hours in order to be able to bring food home on a daily basis.

Desiderio has still not finished building his house, which is why he has decided to build a perimeter wall, to see his house completed is his greatest dream. This is why hes is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron and gravel to build a perimeter wall around his home and thus make his home more secure.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, iron and gravel to build a perimeter wall around his house

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Henry Paul

texts.es:
Henry Paul tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará, dicho distrito es mediano y está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que son realizadas en este distrito son el comercio y la agricultura.

Henry Paul se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual trabaja, realiza servicio de transporte público en el distrito de Pucará y caseríos cercanos, además se dedica al comercio de frutas como por ejemplo piñas, naranjas, chirimoyas, etc., cuenta con más de 06 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y asi asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo; de esta forma el espera seguir generando ingresos para poder adquirir una utilidad acéptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry Paul is 37 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has two daughters. He lives with them in the district of Pucará, which is medium sized and located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The main activity in the district are commerce and agriculture.

Henry Paul works offering transportation services. He has his own motorcycle with which he works. He provides public transport services in the district of Pucará and the neighboring villages. He also works selling fruits like pineapples, oranges and cherimoyas, etc. He has more than 6 years experience in this field and has good personal references, moral and economic standing.

He will use the loan to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle thus assuring the proper operation of hie work tool. In this way he hopes to continue to generate income to be able to acquire an adequate profit to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi, to ensure the proper operation of his work equipment.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 67 años de edad, es viuda, vive en casa de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de más animales menores para incrementar su negocio, esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 67 years old, is widowed and lives in a home made of rustic materials in the district of  Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The community where she lives is a small rural zone where residents earn a living mainly from agriculture, trade and raising livestock. 

She earns a living buying and selling young animals such as hens, chickens and ducks amongst others, she has done this for 10 years and has good experience in the business with good personal and working references in the district. 

She will use the loan to invest in buying more young animals to grow her business, this investment will allow her to improve her economic condition and therefore better he living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing more young animals in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Dalmalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dalmalyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock.

Dalmalyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business.

Dalmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merlyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Merlyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Felicidad has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 45 years old, is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Jenny requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Jenny has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make fried food, enchiladas, coconut bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a steer for her business raising cattle.

loans.name: Jillian

texts.en: Jillian is married and works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat, including wood and paint. Jillian has been in this business for three years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 49 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia y humilde desde hace 6 años, junto a sus 4 hijos y su compañera de vida. Él se dedica a cuidar una finca lo cual lo hace con empeño y dedicación desde hace varios años, gracias a su experiencia y responsabilidad es muy reconocido por sus vecinos como un hombre honesto y trabajador. Ricardo desea cambiar el techo de la cocina ya que se encuentra muy deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera y clavos para mejoramiento del techo de la cocina de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que desea que la mejora termine antes del invierno y así poder brindarle a su familia una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 49, has lived in his own humble home for six years along with his four children and his life partner. He makes a living taking care of a farm, which he has done with effort and dedication for several years. Thanks to his experience and responsibility, he is very well-known by his neighbors as a honest, hardworking man. 

Ricardo would like to change out his kitchen roof as it is very deteriorated. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to improve the roof of the kitchen in his home as soon as possible. He would like to finish the improvements before the winter in order to give his family greater security.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to improve the roof of his kitchen.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, está motivado a continuar trabajando con créditos para seguir progresando, el capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de 1 qq de arroz, 1 qq de azúcar, 2 cajas de jabón, 2 cajas de aceite, etc., la mercadería la adquirirá al por mayor para ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes y tener nuevas ganancias.
Con la administración adecuada del crédito anterior su negocio está creciendo, pero las ganancias son de utilidad para ir cancelando la deuda y cubrir las necesidades familiares, ya que su negocio es de subsistencia.
texts.en:
José is motivated to continue working with loans to continue making progress. He is applying for capital to invest in the purchase of one quintal of rice, two quintals of sugar, two boxes of soap, two boxes of oil, etc. He will buy the merchandise wholesale in order to offer better prices to his clients and to have new earnings. 

With the proper administration of his previous loan, his business is growing. His earnings help him to cancel the debt and cover his family's needs, since his business is for subsistence.

loans.use: to buy one quintal of rice, two quintals of sugar, two boxes of soap, two boxes of oil, etc. wholesale to offer better prices to his clients.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, tiene como negocio la comercialización de ganado, tiene una familia integrada por su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad, son las únicas personas que dependen económicamente de él, su negocio lo desarrolla desde hace 2 años, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y cada 15 días lo realiza, manifiesta no contar con ayuda económica del extranjero.
Comprará una vaca parida, será de ayuda para aumentar el inventario de la ganadería, pretende seguir adquiriendo experiencia para que su negocio se mantenga con vida y generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Para Juan es importante cumplir el objetivo de administrar bien el crédito que ha solicitado para poder tener las ganancias que utilizara y pagar rápidamente su deuda.
texts.en:
Juan has a business trading livestock. His family is made up of his wife and his 7-year-old daughter. They are the only people who depend on him financially. He has had his business for two years. He learned this profession from his father and he does it every fifteen days. He states that he is not receiving financial assistance from abroad.

He will buy a calved cow, which will help him to increase his livestock inventory. He plans to continue gaining experience to keep his business alive and earn the necessary financial income to give his family a better lifestyle.

For Juan, it is important to achieve the goal of administering the loan well in order to have earnings which he will use and pay off his debt quickly.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow to increase his livestock inventory.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa de familiares junto a su mamá e hija en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y golosinas en el exterior de los colegios de su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como patos y pollos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos y golosinas para su negocio, con esto ella espera satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, 49, is a single mother.  She lives with her mother and daughter in the home of relatives in a commercial, farming, and ranching community in the district of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She earns a living selling personal care products and sweets outside the schools in her district.  She also raises and sells farm animals such as ducks and chickens.

Teresa's going to use the loan to buy a large quantity of products and sweets for her business.  She hopes to satisfy her customers' needs and tastes, which will allow her to earn more income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products and sweets for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails.

loans.name: Magda Isabel

texts.es: Magda tiene 41 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia y humilde desde hace 5 años, junto a su esposo y su hija de 13 años de edad. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios como domestica desde hace varios años, gracias a su dedicación y esmero logra sacar adelante a su familia y llevar el sustento a su hogar, es reconocida por sus vecinos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Magda desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra muy deteriorado y así poder brindarle mayor seguridad a su hijo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, madera y clavos para mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea que la mejora termine antes del invierno y así sentirse segura y protegida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Magda is 41 years old and has lived in her own humble home for the past 5 years, with her husband and her 13-year-old daughter.  She has worked offering domestic services for the past few years.  Thanks to her dedication and effort she has been able to get her family ahead and provide for her home. She is known by her neighbors as a responsible and hard-working woman.

Magda would like to replace the roof of her home since it is now very deteriorated and this will allow her to offer her son more safety.  For this she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy steel sheets, woods, and nails to improve her home, since she wants to finish before the winter so that her family is safe and protected in their home.

loans.use: to buy steel sheets, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en:
Elenida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elenida is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Elenida has a buy-and-sell used clothes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of used clothes to sell like T-shirts, polo shirts, pants, etc.

Elenida has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of used clothes to sell like T-shirts, polo shirts, pants, etc

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en:
Dindo is 51 years old. He is married with two children and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio. For a living, Dindo manages his rice farm. He also engages in palay trading and a rice retailing business. He has mastered doing these types of activities over the years, to support their needs. 

Dindo joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in March of 2011. He is determined and works hard to pursue his goals for the benefit of his family. 

Dindo requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm, and to pay for sacks of "palay" for rice retailing. This will help to provide his children with a good and decent life. Someday, he hopes to buy a truck for easy transport of his produce and varieties of rice.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm, and to pay for sacks of "palay" (unhulled rice) for rice retailing

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods including bread, biscuits, noodles, soap, shampoo, seasonings, and many others. She is a 57-year-old married woman with four children. Her youngest child is 20. She has been running a store for almost eight years now. She also raises and sells hogs as supplemental income.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock for the store, such as soft drinks, canned goods, chips and toiletries. This stock will be very helpful in making her store attractive to her customers. Thus, her daily earnings will improve and she could handle her finances.

She dreams of expanding her business to make it successful in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store.

loans.name: Yemmy Lisset

texts.es: Yemmy tiene 32 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia, ella se siente muy feliz por tener un techo donde poder vivir con su hijo y su compañero de vida. Yemmy  se dedica a la elaboración de tamales los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en las diferentes comunidades, gracias a la venta que realiza logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, por lo que es reconocida como una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Yemmy solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para construir una galera en el área donde elabora los tamales, ya que actualmente lo realiza exponiéndose a altas temperaturas y las inclemencias climáticas.
texts.en: Yemmy is 32 years old and lives in her own home. She feels very happy to have a roof over her head where she can live with her son and her life partner. She earns a living by making tamales, which she sells as a street vendor in different local communities. Thanks to the sales she makes she manages to support the day to day needs of her home, for which she is known as an entrepreneurial and hard working woman. Yemmy is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, wood and nails to construct a covered gallery in the area where she makes the tamales, as she currently does this exposed to high temperatures and inclement weather.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood and nails to construct a covered gallery in the area where she makes tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, gravel, iron and metal sheets to finish constructing a room in her house.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elisa is 40 years old and she has four children who are still in school.

Elisa has a sound system business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and wire and do maintenance for her sound system business.

Elisa has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and wire and do maintenace for her sound system business

loans.name: Liliana Margarita

texts.es:
Liliana, es acompañada, vive con su pareja, la vida que comparten es el estilo típico campesino, dedicada a labores domésticas y trabajos de agricultura, Liliana práctica la crianza de cerdos y la ganadería, sus actividades inician cada mañana con el ordeño de vacas y alimentación de todo el ganado y los cerdos, su pareja le ayuda con los trabajos, sumado a estas actividades también siembra granos básicos para consumo familiar y otra parte lo vende, la dificultad es la escases de agua en la zona,  ya que sus actividades agrícolas no tienen un buen desarrollo.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para llevar acabo la compra de cerdos y alimentos para los mismos, gracias a esta ayuda incrementara sus animales, atenderá a nuevos clientes teniendo así como resultado nuevos ingresos que piensa invertir en mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Sus sueños son tener crecimiento económico, establecer mejor la porqueriza, tener ingresos para mejorar su vivienda y así tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Liliana lives and works with her partner. They have a typical rural lifestyle divided between domestic chores and agricultural work. Liliana breeds pigs and cattle.

She starts work each morning by milking the cows, and feeding all the cattle and pigs. Her partner helps her with these chores. As well as these activities, she also sows basic crops for personal consumption and for selling. The difficulty she faces is the scarcity of water in the area, meaning that her farming business cannot develop well. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy pigs and pig feed and so increase her livestock. Thanks to this, she will gain new clients and earn more income, which she will invest in improving the quality of her life. Her dream is to achieve economic growth, to better establish the pigsty, to have income to improve her home and so have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed to increase her livestock

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, comparte su vida con su esposa, solo ella depende económicamente de él, su negocio es la elaboración de hamacas, aprendió a desempeñar está actividad cuando trabajaba con su padre, se ha independizado desde hace 5 años, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Comprará hilos de colores, texturas y grosores diferentes, para elaborar hamacas en mayor cantidad, su visión es atender mejor a sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas e ingresos para  ser responsable con sus compromisos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de artesanías mucho más grande para tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en: José shared his life with his wife with only her depending on him economically. His business is making hammocks which he learned while doing this activity as work with his father. He became independent 5 years ago. He works from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. He will buy thread of different colors, textures and thickness to make hammocks in greater quantity. His idea is to serve his clients better, increase his sales and income so he can be responsible with his obligations. His dream is to have a much larger business selling handicrafts to build economic stability.

loans.use: to buy color thread of different textures and thicknesses to make hammocks in greater quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, cement, windows, sand, gravel and metal sheets to install windows and improve the roof of her home

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is an active woman. She was born in a rural area in 1968. She lives in the northern part of Tajikistan with her family. She is married and has one child.

Mavjuda has 15 years of experience doing business in a domestic market. She sells shoes for kids and elders. Each weekend she retails her shoes from the city to rural places. She has regular clients every day.

Here is a photo of Mavjuda showing how she communicates and trades with clients. She is gentle and polite.

Mavjuda requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a new assortment of shoes to sell. She hopes to have a good business and earn money to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 51, lives in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five children. To make a living and support her family, she operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

Mao wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. Josie is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josie has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos con edades de 11 y 13 años de edad, ambos estudian y los hijos mayores ya se independizado, en ocasiones  le ayudan económicamente, la actividad económica que práctica es la venta de granos básicos, crianza y venta de cerdos, también los destaza para vender sus derivados, el negocio lo atiende con ayuda de la familia y por el momento no representa dificultades.
Para mejorar su negocio solicita un crédito para comprar una vaca y pagar el alquiler del terreno en que cultivará granos básicos, con la inversión tendrá un nuevo rubro para generar ingresos que serán de utilidad para cubrir necesidades familiares así como también serán una fuente de alimento.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y tener oportunidad de darle a su familia una alimentación, salud, vestuario y educación apropiada.
texts.en:
Salome is married and lives with his wife and two children, 11 and 13 years old.  Both of his younger children are in school and the older ones are already independent, and occasionally help out with family finances.  He works selling dry grains, raising and selling pigs, and also works to butcher and sell the meat from the pigs.  He runs the business with the help of his family and it is currently going well.

To improve his business he is requesting a loan to buy a cow and pay to rent land to grow dry grains.  With the investment he will have a new field to generate income that he will use to pay for the family's needs, and also be a source of food.  He dreams of expanding his business, increasing his income, and having the opportunity to give his family food, health, clothing and proper education.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pay rent for land to grow grain.

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es: David tiene 24 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida, sus dos pequeñas hijas de 5 años y 3 años de edad, y los dos se esfuerzan día con día para tener el sustento del hogar, y así poder sacar adelante a las dos hijas para que en el futuro puedan optar a una mejor calidad de vida. La experiencia con la que cuenta en su negocio de venta de ropa ambulante, le ha permitido que tanto los clientes como amigos lo recomiendan como responsable. David necesita construir un baño en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo cuenta con pedazos de plástico para proteger esa área de su vivienda, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, grava, hierro, lamina para construir el baño de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and lives with his life partner and their two small daughters, who are 5 and 3 years old. Both of them strive from day to day to support the needs of their household, in this way they can help their two daughters get on in life so that in the future they can aim for a better quality of life. Because of his experience in his business selling clothing as a mobile vendor, both his customers and his friends vouch for him as a responsible man. 

David needs to build a bathroom in his house, as currently he only has pieces of plastic to protect this area of his home. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, gravel and metal sheets to build the bathroom of his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, gravel and metal sheets to build the bathroom of his house.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various office and school supplies needed in her store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of the school and office supplies she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to cover her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Cecilia dreams of having a bigger School/Office Supplies store. She aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and selling vegetables.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 6,750 through NWTF to purchase more bamboo for her bamboo-weaving business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to weave

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, spices, oil, propane gas etc. to make food

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra’s age is 28; she is married, living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her financial condition is neither good nor bad, but her husband does not earn enough to cover household expenses. He is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots, etc. He has been running this business for 10 years and has lot of experience. 

Lately, Sidra's husband has been sick and most of their savings were spend upon his medical treatment. Now he is healed and hearty but does not have funds to buy raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Sidra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw materials such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chip boards, etc., to continue his business. 

Sidra thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and feels happy after this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wooden planks, nails, glue, and chip boards for her husband's furniture business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined HiH EA to benefit from the training on savings mobilization, enterprise development, and financial management. 

Rose practices small-scale farming where she grows cassava and maize. She is borrowing to buy manure to enable her to increase production of maize and cassava for more income to cater for her family's daily expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure to enable her to increase production of maize and cassava for more income to cater for her family's daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories, spare parts, chargers and other items for her business selling and repairing mobile phones.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 11, 16 y 24 años de edad, él siente muy feliz por tener su vivienda propia, brindándole una mayor estabilidad a su familia. Saúl se dedica al trabajo de albañilería contando con 3 años de experiencia, por lo que es muy reconocido por sus trabajos de excelente calidad. Saúl necesita construir un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que su familia es muy numerosa y el siente que  viven en hacinamiento, por lo que  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillos, grava, hierro y lámina para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Saúl is 49 years old, he lives with his wife and their three children of 11, 16 and 24 years old. He feels very pleased to have his own house, which offers a greater level of stability to his family. He earns a living as a builder, having three years of experience, and he is well known for his excellent quality work. 

Saúl needs to construct a room in his house, as his family is very numerous and he feels that they are living in overcrowded conditions. He is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in sand, cement, bricks, gravel, iron and metal sheeting to construct a room in his house.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, bricks, gravel, iron and metal sheeting to construct a room in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and metal sheets to build a room to give her daughters greater privacy

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is getting ready for the next crop season. He wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. He wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer for which he applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Victor hopes to save enough to expand and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more production

loans.name: Komnit's Group

texts.en: Komnit’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Komnit makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, 62 years old, lives in Mahayag, Philippines. She is married and gifted with three children. Corazon's husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural produce. 

Corazon has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband in plowing the rice field and planting corn and other crops. In need of additional working capital, Corazon decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. 

Corazon has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
The person appearing in this photo is Benson. He is 50 years, married with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management.

He rears indigenous poultry and is borrowing to buy chicken feed for increased production of chickens and eggs.  This will increase his income and enable him to pay for construction of a modern house for his family.

He is grateful to Kiva and his lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for increased production of chickens and eggs, hence more income to pay for construction of a modern house for his family.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo is thankful that he accessed a 20,000 PHP loan which he used to pay for accessories and spare parts for his jeepney. His earnings helped cover their personal and household expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan which he will use to pay for the tire replacement, seat cover, registration and maintenance of his jeepney. He thanks God for the safe trips and good turnout for his service and the financial help for it will surely help fund his family's everyday personal and household needs and support his child's schooling.

Karlo aims to sustain his transport business and hopes to buy another jeepney unit. He aims to give his family a more comfortable life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the tires, registration and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She lives in one of the big districts. She is married and has one child. She has ten years of practice doing business serving women.

Since childhood, Surayo has dreamed of owning her own business sewing women's clothing. After graduation from high school, she learned how to sew from private tailors. Unfortunately, she did not have money to buy an up-to-date sewing machine for her fabric.

Now she is busy sewing traditional women's dresses. She has two sewing machines, one is manual and another is computerized. Also, she has students who are learning how to sew. She is trying to enlarge her business and open further business.

Surayo is asking for a loan to buy textiles to sew costumes, jackets and pants. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sew costumes, jackets and pants.

loans.name: Oscar Esau

texts.es: Oscar tiene 28 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyar a su madre en su vejez. Él se gana la vida desde hace varios años como técnico de una empresa local, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con esta fuente de ingresos económicos que le permiten sostener la economía de su hogar. Oscar ha decidido instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y mano de obra para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old and lives in his own home together with his mother, and feels happy to be able to support his mother in her old age. He has earnt a living for several years as a technician in a local business, and feels very pleased to count on this source of income that allows him to support his household economically. 

Oscar has decided to install a brick floor in his house and is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in brick flooring, cement, sand and labour costs to install the brick floor and in this way improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to invest in brick flooring, cement, sand and labour costs to install a brick floor in his house.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is a 20-year-old single student who is from the Pursat Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in nursing, and is in her second year at a university in the province. Her father is a doctor and her mother runs a business at home. Because Sokheng is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the third to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, she hopes to run her own clinic.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees from the third to the fourth year

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has one child. She is well known and one of the active trustee clients at IMON. She has a canteen where she serves a lot of people traditional meals and cake every day. She also takes orders for preparing traditional pastry “Sambusa” for wedding parties. She bakes and cooks tasty and delicious meals. Nasiba asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy necessary products for her meals and enlarge the assortment on her menu. She will buy products like flour, oil, batter, species, greens, vegetables, meat, etc. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy necessary products for her meals and enlarge the assortment on her menu.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee is 30 years old and married with three children who are in school. Mydee works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Mydee has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mydee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Araceli requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials and equipment such as fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Araceli has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and equipment such as fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Brenda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Brenda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erni

texts.en:
Mrs. Erni has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency on Java, Indonesia's, most heavily populated island.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water.

Mrs. Erni heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held a safe-water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs. Erni, who is also a healthworker in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda works hard to support her family. Reynelda is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials such as wood, nails, and paints and pay for laborers' salaries.

Reynelda has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Reynelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, nails, and paints and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Transito De Jesus

texts.es: Transito tiene 58 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 18 años de edad, por la cual se esfuerza para que salga adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas desde hace 6 años, por lo que gracias a su popularidad en la zona es muy bien recomendada por sus amigos y vecinos como una persona responsable y con deseos de superacion. Transito desea comprar productos para surtir su venta, por lo que ella solicita un credito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de diferentes golosinas, ya que desea incrementar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida y asi mismo apoyar a su hija para que pueda seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Transito is 58 years old and lives in her own home together with her life partner and her daughter who is 18 years old, for whom she strives to give opportunities. She has earned a living selling sweets and candy for 6 years, and thanks to her popularity in the area she is well recommended by her friends and neighbours as a responsible person with a desire for self-improvement.

Transito wishes to buy products to supply her business, for which she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of different sweets. She wishes to increase her income to have a better quality of life and also support her daughter so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of different sweets.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa tiene 47 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su hijo de 15 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa. Ella se dedica al comercio y posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años, porque gracias a su dedicación y amabilidad es muy recomendada por sus vecinos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Teresa desea comprar una variedad de productos para surtir su tienda, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder tener una mejoría en su calidad de vida y para la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old, she lives in her own home alongside her son who is 15 years old, whom she has managed to bring up as a single mother, for which she feels very proud. She works in business and has had a small shop for two years, and thanks to her dedication and friendliness she is well recommended by her neighbours as a responsible and hardworking woman.

Teresa wishes to buy a variety of products to stock her shop, for which she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of merchandise. In this way she can increase her income and be able to have a better quality of life and help with the education of her son.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her small shop of basic goods.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful that she was granted a PHP 17,000 loan, which she used to buy chicken, pork and veggies, fruits and seasonings for her food market. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for PHP 30,000 which she will use to buy dozens of chicken, fish, fruits and vegetables she sells at retail price at her small general store. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely fund their daily sustenance and her children's schooling.

Alma plans to rent a stall in their town's public market to reach more customers. She prays for God's guidance and protection for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables to sell at her store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and food vending. Cristina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Adoranie

texts.en:
Adoranie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Adoranie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal and other materials for her business.

Adoranie has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto con sus 3 hijos, se siente feliz y agradecida por tener un hogar donde poder vivir. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace varios años, por lo que gracias a su laboriosidad y empeño logra sacar a delante a sus tres hijos y así suplir sus necesidades. Reina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, grava, ventanas, cemento y mano de obra, para encementar el piso del corredor e instalar ventanas en su vivienda, ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra, lo que provoca muchas enfermedades respiratorias especialmente a los más pequeños del hogar, por lo que espera poder contar con el apoyo de este crédito.
texts.en:
Reina is 35 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children. She feels happy and grateful to have somewhere to live. She has made a living providing domestic services for a number of years. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she is able to support her three children and meet their needs.

Reina is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, windows, cement and to pay for labour to cement the corridor floor and fit windows in her home. This is because at the moment, the floor is a dirt floor, which causes many respiratory illnesses, especially in the youngest children in the family. This is why she hopes she can access a loan.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, windows, cement and to pay for labour to cement the corridor floor and fit windows in her home.

loans.name: Kumushoi

texts.en: Kumushoi is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has children. Kumushoi is a trustee and active client at IMON. For about 17 years she has had an activity buying and selling grocery products. She has her own store where she sells products. Her husband helps and supports her – it is a family business. She works to have a better standard of living. Only this business feeds her family because there is no any other activity in her area to do. The residents of her living area know her very well. She has permanent clients every day. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy additional products for her store. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy grocery products. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Meet Grace, a resilient entrepreneur who is actively involved in many income-generating activities, the main one being agriculture. Grace is blessed with six good looking children with her handsome hubby. They live together on a small plot of land in Tombe village. She started with next to nothing and seventeen years later, she is keeping rabbits and a dairy cow. She is also growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. She also owns a small business that brings in some extra profit. 

Grace is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Crop farming is bringing her good income but the only problem is that it is seasonal. She is seeking to start poultry farming because poultry farming is doing well in the market and the income is regular. Poultry farming will sustain her family as she waits for other produce to be ready for the market. With your funding, Grace is going to use the income from your investment to repay the loan and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 51 years old, a married woman and mother of seven children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it fully functional. 

For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

Naseem gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 27-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to build up some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.
