Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can replace the auto-rickshaw body with a new one.
 
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings by the time her children get married. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en:
Latifan is a 37-year-old religious and energetic woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. She belongs to a middle-class family. Her husband is the sole person responsible for paying all household expenses for old parents, young children and siblings. His younger brother is still a student and is studying in college.

Latifan's husband owns a corporation store in which he offers televisions, washing machines, steel almiras (cabinets), sewing machines, juicers, grinders and ovens for sale on cash payment as well as on installment payments. He also offers a one-year warranty for each product. Most of his female customers purchase home appliances for making dowry for their daughters. Nowadays, the demand for LCD televisions has increased in the market. He wants to add an inventory for offering to his worthy customers, but he does not have enough cash in hand for purchasing LCD televisions.

Therefore, Latifan has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan, her husband will buy LCD televisions. She is very happy after taking this loan. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase LCD televisions for offering from his corporation store.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in a small city with her family. She is married and has three children. After graduation from high school, she started to do business in order to help her parents financially. She is a responsible and capable person since her childhood. Recently, she has a job trading kid’s clothing. She sells good quality clothes and has permanent clients. She is well known among friends and sellers as a gentle and polite person. She is planning to buy a new assortment of clothes for kids. She asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a new assortment of clothes for the coming season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing for the coming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron, gravel and sand to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a mother of five children and has a sari-sari store in Sta. Filomenia, Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been in her business for 2 years and generates income to sustain the needs of her family. She has also been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since 2012. She requested a loan amount of Php 11,000.00 to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

With this loan, Jessica will definitely increase her income.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: SONIA: Es originaria de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 60 años, viuda de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para reparar las paredes de madera de su casa de tambo. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  tener una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: SONIA is a native of Waspam and belongs to the Miskito ethnicity. She is 60 years old, the widow of 3 adult children. She works as a Primary school teacher. She is requesting her first loan to repair the walls of her wooden house which is built on stilts. With this loan she can buy planed wood, nails and cover the cost of labor. Her dream is to have a more secure house in good condition.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her wooden house on  stilts.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie is 30 years old and single. She is living with her parents in Sindangan, Philippines. Leonie has a retail business; she sells cell phone loads. She has had this business for three years. She finds it interesting because she can earn income easily. She requested a loan to pay for an additional amount of load for retail. Expanding her inventory will mean an increase to her income. Leonie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. In the future, she hopes to attain a decent home for her parents.

loans.use: to pay for an additional amount of cell phone loads for retail

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa is a widow with 5 adult children. She lives in Oroquieta. She became a regular member of PMPC and has actively participated in the various programs and services offered by the Co-op. She is a farmer who plants corn, vegetables and beans. Farming is her major source of income. In order to generate additional income for their daily needs, she is engaged in snack vending. Generosa borrowed money from the Co-op to buy additional ingredients for her food snack business to increase production. She dreams of nothing more than to live a comfortable life and have an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food snack business to increase production

loans.name: Sehar

texts.en:
Sehar is 27 years old, a married woman and mother of two sons. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it fully functional. 

For this reason, Sehar has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Sehar gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio, tiene una familia de la cual es responsable, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad, trabaja desde hace más de 10 años en la agricultura, su horario es de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, por el momento no presenta problemas para continuar trabajando.
Comprará ganado de crianza, fortalecerá el negocio para mantenerlo en el mercado, sus esfuerzos serán enfocados en trabajar para tener beneficios como una situación financiera favorable y nuevos clientes.
Para Claudio su visión es seguir ampliando su negocio y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudio is the head of his family. He lives with his partner and his 12-year-old child. He has worked in agriculture for over 10 years. He works from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon, and at the moment he has no problems that would prevent him from continuing to work.

He will buy cattle to rear and strengthen his business to keep it on the market. He will focus his efforts on working to reap the benefits of this, such as a favourable financial situation and new customers.

Claudio's vision is to continue growing his business and offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to rear and strengthen his business to keep it on the market.

loans.name: Loana

texts.es: LOANA: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 47 años de edad. Trabaja como enfermera. Madre soltera de 4 hijos en edad escolar. Debido a que con su salario no le cubre para solventar los gastos escolares, está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Zapatos, mochila, uniformes, cuadernos, lapiceros, entre otros útiles y materiales escolares para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella su ella con seguir apoyando a sus hijos y que logren estudiar su carrera universitaria y ser profesionales exitosos y con valores.
texts.en:
Loana is a real fighter, and is from Waspam. She belongs to the Miskita ethinic group, and is 47 years old. She works as a nurse. She is a single mother to four school-aged children. Since her salary does not cover school costs, she is requesting a loan to buy shoes, rucksacks, uniforms, notebooks, pencils, and other school materials and supplies to support her children.

She dreams of continuing to support her children and for them to study at university and become successful professionals with their own values.

loans.use: to buy shoes, rucksacks, uniforms, notebooks, pencils, and other school materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a weighing machine, plastic, iron, aluminum, and others, since he wishes to improve the financial situation at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in cement, sand, gravel, blocks and iron to finish construction of her lavatory-bathroom.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, 44, is married with eight children, four of whom still attend school. She  is a resident of the town of Javier, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety store), selling basic commodities like cooking oil, sugar, eggs, condiments, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries. She has been running a store for five years.

Anecita is requesting a loan to purchase goods for the store, like  biscuits, chips, seasonings and beverages. This stock could be a great help to her family because it would help her improve the content and volume of goods already for sale. In this way, her income will slowly improve, and she will be able to handle her finances. 

Anecita is determined to properly manage her current business to become productive in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores are everywhere in the Philippines. Sari-sari means "variety." As such, they provide people with products mostly needed in everyday survival -- from products for personal hygiene, such as shampoo, toothpaste and powder, to condiments, foods, canned goods and other low-cost items. This is why many of those who want to go into business often start as a sari-sari vendor: With a little capital, you can automatically operate a store and earn an income. 

That was the case for Petronila, 68, from Caloocan City, in Metro Manila. She became involved in this kind of business 30 years ago. Through all those years, she was able to provide for her four children through her income from the store. What she does is basically buy products in large quantities, then display them in her store and sell them at retail, often at a price that is affordable for her customers but higher than the original price so she can make a profit. 

One cannot expect a regular and stable income from this business, since sales vary from time to time. For this reason, Petronila is requesting a loan of  20,000 Philippine pesos to buy more products to display in her store. Certainly, this will really help her attract more customers and improve her business. 

Petronila meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her studies on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to display in her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has three children are presently in school. Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Jocelyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, soft drinks, and other personal care products.

Juliet has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, soft drinks, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is an active girl. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in small city with her family. She has been responsible and capable girl since her childhood. For about a year she has been doing a business and helping her parents financially. She is trading women’s clothes and underwear. She is satisfied and has permanent clients. She exports her goods from foreign countries once a month. She tries to live better with her family. 

Nigora is asking for financial support to buy another collection of women’s clothes for next season. She hopes to be supported. This loan will help her to trade more, and to gain profits for family expenditures like food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy another collection of women's clothes for next season.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children. 

For almost a year she has done a business. With the purpose of improving her standards of living she started to do this business. She is buying and selling a variety of clothing like bed linen, bath towels, women clothing, etc. She intends to enlarge her business in the future. 

Sadi requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a collection of new clothes for women. She hopes to be supported and have permanent clients.

loans.use: to buy a collection of new clothes for women.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 40 years old, is married with two kids and is a resident of SWP, Calamba, Philippines. 

Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She has been in this business for more than a 2 years. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last June 2013. 

Recently, Gina decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 45, is married with two children, one who is still in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 29 years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Imelda has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy an additional fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 37 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Emelyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 40 years old and married with eight children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. She raises pigs and sells them in her community or at the market. She started her business two years ago.

Alice has requested this loan to buy piglets, pig feed and building materials to improve her pig shed. She hopes to use her profits to help cover her family's weekly expenses and to improve her pig business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy three piglets, pig feed and timber for her piggery.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 49 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for one year. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazha

texts.en:
Nazha is a 46-year-old Palestinian, and a married mother of two. Since Palestinians have limited access to many working sectors in Lebanon, she and her husband were forced to work in agriculture and tend to their crops. 

Eight years ago she started her own business, to increase her income and develop her living. Nazha is a hard worker and a mother who sacrifices herself and who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. 

Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of covering her children's needs and expenses.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn, a hardworking and diligent mother, is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She has never tired of supporting her family. 

Angelyn sells snacks and barbecue. Her business is doing well as she doubles her time perfecting the taste of her barbecue. Angelyn has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

She has taken another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients to cater to more customers and be able to accept new orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack and food recipe to increase sales. 

Today, Angelyn is able to save money from her earnings. In the future, she wants to repair her house and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to cater to more customers and be able to accept new orders

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 25 years old and lives in Oroquieta. In order to help the family, she sells dried fish. Aside from selling dried fish, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2014, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 14,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling dried fish is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma faces considerable preparation for the farm planting of palay (rice) in Lusot, Baliangao. She wants to ensure that the laborers she pays work efficiently and apply the fertilizer in a proper way. She presented her loan proposal to Paglaum MPC for financial assistance. Emma hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Derna

texts.en:
As a  parent of four children, Derna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell crude oil and gasoline business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Derna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of crude oil and gasoline to sell for her buy and sell crude oil and gasoline business.

Derna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of crude oil and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Linde

texts.en:
Linde works hard to support her family. Linde is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Linde requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

Linde has been in this business for 1 year now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucia is 52 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lucia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lucia has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like soy sauce, meat, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Jonna has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like soy sauce, meat, spices and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline and do maintenance on her motorcycle.

Maribel has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, gasoline and do maintenance on her motorcycle.
